You could also assign each display of 1 frame to a different family member. So only their photos stream to that frame. Great when the kids have left home.




Feel more connected to your family




Photine frames have a contemporary design with a tiered construction. So some displays are raised above others. This dynamic offers a beautiful yet subtle contrast to the products.




Photine frames have been kept as simple as possible, with only a single domed button to turn the product on and off.







Pick specific albums and pictures to display rather than use smart albums. 
Photine stores the last 1000 images in its memory so you still have plenty of photos to display if your WiFi disconnects. 
Temporarily assign a display to a friend or family member. Great for when they are travelling and you get their holiday images displaying in real time back home. 
Support for: Facebook, Dropbox, iPhoto, Mac OSX, Windows, Flickr, Picasa, Google Drive and Instagram. 
On/off timer. Photine can automatically turn itself on and off according to the time. So you can set it to never display when you're asleep and wake you up with the latest images of your family.
No duplicates. If you have more than 1 Photine frame they can communicate with each other and make sure that the same photo doesn't appear on a different frame around the same time.












At Nine Studios we're committed to giving you the product you want and we have far too many features we wanted to add into our devices. These are some that haven't made the initial cut but if there's any you particularly want to see let us know. We still have time to add these features if there are any you all really care about, especially if we exceed our funding goal. As a company we design smart home products so many of these features are to make Photine frames a wider part of the smart home, connecting with third party devices and services.

iTunes Album Art - So the frame can monitor what your iTunes is playing on the computer and can display the currently playing album cover on one of the screens.
Music Visualiser - You may have seen the iTunes music visualiser which displays moving colours and patterns in time with the music your playing. A very attractive display. What if we could get this type of functionality across the multiple displays on a Photine frame?
Online Setup - When you buy your Photine frame on our site what if you could configure what the frame will display before it arrives. Use our web portal to sign into your Facebook account, select the albums/people etc you want to show and then when you receive your frame, log in to the WiFi and off it goes. Great for getting as a present for someone, especially if they are less technically inclined.
Ambient Lighting - Lighting is a powerful emotional factor. Just ask the guys at Philips making the Hue colour changing light bulbs. These are smart bulbs that can be controlled from a smart phone. Photine could integrate with these devices so you could set up ambient moods with just 1 button. Turn on the romantic setting and have the light bulbs dim down to a nice red shade whilst Photine starts playing a smooth visualiser motion like the iTunes visualiser mentioned above.
Smart home integration - We are getting more and more affordable smart home products. From WiFi speakers and doorbells to energy management and security. Photine can work with these products to provide extra functionality. Someone rings the WiFi doorbell and Photine displays a video feed of who is at the door.







Pledge £25 and get our exclusive for Indiegogo, Photine unisex t-shirt.




Or choose our glorious Nine Studios glass.






Everyone has different tastes, different needs, different styles of homes and we know that we can't design a perfect digital photo frame for everyone. This is why we're creating an open hardware community at Nine Studios. Where we give manufacturers, designers, other companies and hobbyists access to our technology and allow them to buy sub assemblies of our products. So they can create their own unique frames using different materials, finishes or layouts. All without needing to know anything about electronics or software development. It can be as easy as making a one off wooden frame in your garage and fitting it to one of our sub assemblies, all the way through to mass production. This means that you as consumers get more choice with a Photine frame that fits in your home and with your own personal aesthetic. Please purchase our open hardware pledge if you are interested in joining this community or email c.jackson@ninestudios.com for more details.




£14,000 on Indiegogo & payment Fees
£150,000 on the manufacture of the products
£36,000 on the final engineering development




Our plans are to have all the engineering and software development finished by Spring 2014. We want to have our manufacturing to begin shortly afterwards and to be ready to ship the products in the Summer of 2014. 
Where are we now:
We've been working on these photos frames since the beginning of 2013 and have since played with many weird and wonderful concepts, sketches and designs. Our current designs took form just before the summer and our recent prototypes are constructed using tablet computers, so that full functionality can be easily simulated whilst our electronic engineers test our hardware systems. This means that most of the functions portrayed in the video and this description are at a simulated stage but are an accurate representation of what we can achieve.






Photine is designed by London based startup Nine Studios, a product design company that designs, develops and sells consumer friendly smart home products.




We have a great team with experience in the design of smart home products, launching and successfully selling businesses and the manufacture of complex engineering and avionic components. 
Charlie Jackson - Founder & Product Design Engineer
MSc Technology Entrepreneurship, BEng Product Design & Manufacture, 3 years designing and researching smart home products. Currently shortlisted for Britain's Top Real Role Model.
@charliejackson
Feel free to contact him at: c.jackson@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
Rob Wollner - Technical Director
Programmer, worked in R&D for a number of years creating bespoke technological solutions, patent pending, featured in BBC technology news for winning various hacking competitions.
@wollno
Feel free to contact him at: r.wollner@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
Tom Brassington - Programme Director & Systems Engineer
Senior Avionics Design Engineer, working in avionics over 6 years, MEng Avionics & Aerospace Systems Engineering.
Feel free to contact him at: t.brassington@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
Georgia Pell-Johnson - Marketing Director
MscEcon Marketing, BScEcon Business & Management, over 6 years experience as a social media marketing manager.
@pellykins
Feel free to contact her at: g.pell.johnson@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
Viki Bell - Advertising Director & Public Relations Officer
BA Art & Design, furthered her advertising education at the University of Arts London, as an artist has had numerous exhibitions and specialises in visual layouts and digital media.
@vikiibell
Feel free to contact her at: v.bell@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
Taimoor Bajwa - Electronics Engineer
BEng Electronic & Electrical Engineering with a background in coding and running his own business for 5 years before joining Nine Studios.
Feel free to contact him at: t.bajwa@ninestudios.com for any enquiries.
In addition to our core team we have 3 additional software developers and several mentors with great industry experience. 




As always the main risk involved with a project like this whether we can deliver on our promise with the money we raise. We are telling you that we can. Our costs are extremely low; we've won free office space and have extremely low staff costs (as a young company our employees are here because they believe in our project and are rewarded with equity instead of using up the money you are giving us). 
We also have the capability to do it. We have a great team as mentioned above and fully believe in wider collaboration with the community. This is why we're launching our open hardware community. This is a journey we are all taking together, not just our team. We value your support and input as much as our own.


We want to use this Indiegogo campaign as an opportunity to find and accept help and advice for all of you. If you have any ideas, feedback or suggestions please get in contact with us. If you think you can help us make these products better, in a shorter time or even want to join our team as we bring these products to market and develop further smart home products get in touch as well. We're always on the lookout for talented individuals who want to join a high growth design and technology company.



Call our founder, Charlie Jackson on +44 (0) 7522 994760 for any and all queries. 
You can also email him at c.jackson@ninestudios.com and he will personally make sure your questions get answered by himself or the right member of the team.

story:
Crafted to change the way you work, the 37°C Smart Home Magic Desk is the world’s first gesture-controlled, height-adjustable smart desk.

It’s no secret that standing at work is great for upping output. So after researching productivity-boosting practices, we decided to take standing desks to greater heights.  

What resulted is an award-winning* smart desk that’s built with selected materials and advanced technology — allowing you to work at your best with ease and convenience. 

Meet the desk that works for you.

 

                                                   

 

Raise or lower the desk by simply placing your hand over the sensors — no buttons necessary. Set it to your ideal height between 25 and 51 inches, and work in a way that suits you.

 

But it’s the Integrated LED Smart Lamp desktop unit that makes this smart desk so, well, smart. 

 

 

With sensory technology, it flashes a gentle prompt if your posture needs correcting or you’ve been at your desk too long. After all, working smarter means working healthier, and should you leave your desk for ten minutes, the light turns off automatically and turns on again on your return. 

 

 

Additional features include both wireless charging and a USB port for your cell phone.

 

Charging can only be used when the Smart Lamp is plugged into a power source.

 

To top it off, the Smart Lamp is movable after charging, meaning you can further personalize your work environment.

 

Where other standing desks are bulky, rigid and user-unfriendly, the Magic Desk is ergonomically designed to bring comfort, style and simplicity to the modern workplace.

 

 

With three classic colors (black, white and walnut) and two length sizes (58" and 47) to choose from, all of which are made with dense medium-density fiberboard, the Magic Desk makes a fine addition to any home or work space. 

 

Standing while working isn’t just a fad. Charles Dickens, Virginia Woolf and Ernest Hemingway wrote their best works standing up.

 

 

Although we can’t promise you’ll write a classic novel on one of our Magic Desks, you can at least improve your productivity and health.

Start with productivity. Standing at work boosts motivation and output in ways that hunching over a desk does not. A recent experiment from Texas A&M University found that employees who used standing desks were 46% more productive than those at traditional desks.  

 

 

As for health, even if you regularly exercise, research shows that long periods of inactivity sitting in the office are detrimental to health no matter how much time you spend at the gym after work.  

Moreover, most of us are familiar with the back aches and pains caused by bad posture from sitting at our desks. Standing, on the other hand, helps maintain good posture and counts as physical activity.  

No wonder Dickens, Woolf and Hemingway all worked this way.  

 

Have you ever wanted to move objects with gestures like a wizard?

 

 

37°C Smart Home designer Wu Junfeng certainly did. That’s how he came up with the concept for a contactless-controlled standing desk that could be raised and lowered easily.

“Actually my first thought was only about designing a desk that its height can be controlled by gestures,” Mr Wu explained.    

“Then the idea evolved into a comprehensive workplace solution: how could the desk help maximize your work performance? Could it also play a role in caring for your health, to deliver messages for you actively?”  

 

 

One idea soon spread to others. Mr Wu decided to include a desktop unit that would gently prompt users to correct their posture and take regular breaks.  

“I think the healthcare Magic Desk provides is one of the factors that make it unique,” he added.  

And by being a standing desk user himself, Mr Wu knew how they raised productivity. Since he started standing while working, he found himself more likely to walk around and talk with colleagues, collaborating and bouncing ideas off them, as he was already standing up.  

 

 

The result of his ideas? A complete workplace solution that not only promoted healthy working habits, but also could encourage everyone to work smarter.  

That’s the magic of Mr Wu’s Magic Desk.

 

About Us

Founded in July 2017, 37°C Smart Home is a team of specialists with a shared goal to create the perfect work space in and out of the office. 

We do this by creating products that are as clever as they are stylish, striking a balance between smart technology and aesthetics.

In practice that means fewer buttons and wires for a better design — all without compromising on the intelligence of our products.

 

 

Finished Product Shipped out

From design to manufacture, after months of efforts,  we have completed the process of mass production of Magic Desk, with the first finished products already shipped out to our customers in January 2019.

story:
Discover the magic of kinetic art, communicate, meditate, relax. All of this and more thanks to design, modern technology, and art, all combined into a unique table that brings you a new dimension of smart home and communication combined with relaxation and the experience of uniqueness.

 

Let yourself be absorbed by the smooth movement of a ball in the sand. The ball can draw complex mandala ornaments as well as your own pictures on request.

 

ZEUS

 

Zeus has a beautiful robust design with a simple shelf for storing all your necessities. The most dominant design feature of this table is the base. It is made of two massive steel pieces that make the table slide on the carpet with ease. Zeus is the true god of all tables.

Size: 36.4"x22.6"x18.7" (925x575x475mm)

Weight: approx. 110lb (50kg)

Category: Premium

 

HELIOS

 

Helios will brighten up your home, just like the god of the Sun. Helios is also a robust table with a shelf and a base made of one welded steel piece which makes the table a really luxurious item.

Size: 36.4"x22.6"x18.7" (925x575x475mm)

Weight: approx. 110lb (50kg)

Category: Premium

 

ARTEMIS

 

Artemis has a very airy base formed by legs made of steel rods symbolizing three arrows belonging to Artemis, the goddess of the hunt. Its design is very versatile and it fits into almost any home.

Size: 36.4"x22.6"x18.7" (925x575x475mm)

Weight: approx. 77lb (35kg)

Category: Style

 

KAIROS

 

Kairos is a timeless classic. The base is made of four wooden legs with a slight incline emphasizing its stability. Kairos is the god of time and opportunity, just like this table is the perfect opportunity to make your home beautiful. 

Size: 36.4"x22.6"x18.7" (925x575x475mm)

Weight: approx. 77lb (35kg)

Category: Style

 

TYCHÉ

Tyché has four legs made of steel which give the table a modern look. Tyche is a graceful goddess of fortune who undoubtedly used her power to make the GlyGlo project possible.

Size: 36.4"x22.6"x18.7" (925x575x475mm)

Weight: approx. 77lb (35kg)

Category: Style

 

 

I wanted a table that could charge my phone without having my chargers lying everywhere. I also wanted it to be able to tell me what the weather would be like and display my calendar notifications. All of this, without disturbing the harmony of the room with a large display. Then, I came across kinetic art and realized that this was it!

This was the right way to get a table with all the features I wanted while keeping the design modern, smooth, and relaxing. During the development, we added even more smart features to our design. And that is how GlyGlo was created.

 

 

I wanted to create a coffee table which would be interesting, useful and fun in terms of design. Since I always struggled with chargers and cables lying everywhere, my first requirement for the table was to be able to wirelessly charge phones. Once there was the electricity supply in the table, the possibilities increased significantly.

The second idea was to display the weather. However, in today's time full of various digital displays everywhere, I wanted a different form of display. One that would not flicker at me annoyingly. After a long search for the right display method, drawing in the sand became the most elegant form that is extremely romantic while it also provides a huge display area that has immense possibilities of use. It displayed the weather, but that covered the potential of this device very minimally.

Eventually, I began to realize the possibilities. We gradually added more features such as drawing pictures, sending messages, displaying calendar notifications, etc. New features will be gradually added as the community of users grows. The device can be updated online, so the table you get now can only do a few things compared to the device it will become in the future. The table also has an integrated backlight, so you can change colors and light intensity.

The device can be updated online, so the table you get now can only do a few things compared to the device it will become in the future. The table also has an integrated backlight, so you can change colors and light intensity.

story:
Know when something moves, gets wet, gets too hot or too cold

FYI sensors are a simple solution to let you know if something moves, gets wet or is too hot or cold. 

FYI sensors they are incredibly easy to setup, turn on and off and monitor directly from an app on your iPhone or Android device.


How does FYI Devices work?

Simply place an FYI sensor on doors, windows, in crawl spaces, basements, under sinks or just about anywhere you want to detect motion, liquid accumulation or changes in temperature. Connect the sensor to the FYI app on your smartphone and start monitoring. You will receive a text message when something changes so you can respond immediately.


"FYI – Your front door moved."

"FYI – Your master bedroom window moved."

"FYI – Your office door moved."

"FYI – Your road bike moved."

"FYI – Your basement is wet."

"FYI – Your gate moved."

"FYI – Your wine cellar is above 65 degrees."

"FYI – Your bathroom sink pipes are wet."

"FYI – Your water heater drain pan is wet."

"FYI – Your outside faucet dropped below 32 degrees."

A base station connects to your WiFi router and can communicate with up to 100 sensors with a range of up to 500 feet (using 900 MHz) providing greater coverage and reliability than BlueTooth or WiFi.


Where the funds will go

The design of our first product is nearly complete, but we need your help in order to get into production. Once our funding goal is reached we will use the funds to further optimize the internal components and do final testing and then move forward with manufacturing and production. Creating the tooling for injection molding is expensive and in order to bring this product to market, we will have to order a large number of Starter Packs from the factory. We will also finalize the application for both iPhone and Android and submit it for approval. Backers will get detailed updates as we continue to move toward production. 


Development

The team has been working on FYI Devices for over a year and we are excited to be nearing completion. We are working with proven technology and have selected quality vendors to help bring our first product to market. We are continuing to refine technical aspects of the product as well as the design and functionality of the smartphone app.


Giving Back

As you help us bring FYI Devices to market, we want to also provide help to others. We have partnered with Habitat for Humanity Portland/Metro East by donating 2% of the funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign. Habitat is one of the only organizations that offers homeownership opportunities to hardworking families making as little as $20,800 (for a family of four). This is done through a hand-up, not handout model in which homeowners help to build and then buy their home from Habitat. Join us during this holiday season in helping those in need to enjoy the comfort of a safe, warm home.


Team

Jon Maroney, co-founder -  Jon has been involved with early stage technology companies throughout his career, working on product development, technical management, business and strategy. He has founded several mobile technology companies and served on the executive team as CEO, CTO and CMO at companies such as Dantz (now EMC), Handmark (now Sprint) and StoryCode (now TigerLogic). He loves cool new technology and thinking about ways that it can be applied to everyday life. 

Greg Hinzmann, designer - Greg has been a design consultant for over twenty years, designing products for companies large and small such as Nike, Logitech, HP, Dell, Intel and many others.

Wendy Slocum, marketing - Wendy has marketing and management experience overseeing projects and new business development within agency and client-side organizations such as adidas, Outward Bound, Mentor Graphics and entrepreneurial technology firms. She has a passion for start-up environments and has developed brands and organizational infrastructures for both for-profit and non-profit organizations.


Risks and Challenges 

Every new product faces challenges as it is brought to market. Sourcing all the components and aligning all the manufacturing and logistics partners can get complicated, but we will work hard to ensure we stay on schedule.

As with any sensors that communicate via radio, there is fine tuning that will need to be done as we progress to ensure the optimal range and responsiveness in the widest number of uses.

Also, since an iPhone app is an integral part of the FYI Devices experience, we are working to make sure the app is ready and accepted by the App Store and Google Play well ahead of final production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking a look at the FYI Devices campaign!  Even if you are unable to contribute, you can be part of our community by spreading the word and helping us make some noise about FYI Devices on Facebook  and Twitter.

CTO and CMO at companies such as Dantz (now EMC), Handmark (now Sprint) and
StoryCode (now TigerLogic). He loves cool new technology and thinking about
ways that it can be applied to everyday life. 
Greg Hinzmann, designer - Greg has been a design consultant for over twenty years, designing products for companies large and small such as Nike, Logitech, HP, Dell, Intel and many others.
Wendy Slocum, marketing - Wendy has marketing and management experience overseeing projects and new business development within agency and client-side organizations such as adidas, Outward Bound, Mentor Graphics and entrepreneurial technology firms. She has a passion for start-up environments and has developed brands and organizational infrastructures for both for-profit and non-profit organizations.



Risks and Challenges 
Every new product faces challenges as it is brought to market. Sourcing all the components and aligning all the manufacturing and logistics partners can get complicated, but we will work hard to ensure we stay on schedule.
As with
any sensors that communicate via radio, there is fine tuning that will need to
be done as we progress to ensure the optimal range and responsiveness in the
widest number of uses.
Also, since an iPhone app is an integral part of the FYI
Devices experience, we are working to make sure the app is ready and accepted
by the App Store and Google Play well ahead of final production.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Thank you for taking a look at the FYI Devices campaign!  Even if you are unable to contribute, you can be part of our community by spreading the word and helping us make some noise about FYI
     Devices on Facebook  and Twitter.

story:
Tutoriel paiement par carte / Credit card payment tutorial  :

Suite à certains retours de votre part nous rapportant des difficultés pour le paiement par carte bancaire, nous vous avons préparé ce tutoriel.

After several feedbacks from you, reporting some problems for the payment by credit card, we've prepared this tutorial.

1ère étape / 1st step :

Une fois que vous avez choisi une contribution, passez à l'étape de paiement. Même si vous n'avez pas de compte Pay Pal et que vous souhaitez payer par carte, cliquez sur "Aller sur PayPal".

Once you've chosen your pledge, go to the payment step. Even if you don't have a Pay Pal account and you want to pay by credit card, you have to click on "Go on PayPal".


2ème étape / 2nd step :

Cliquez sur l'option de paiement par carte "Payer par carte bancaire". Ignorez la connexion  à Pay Pal.

Click on the credit card payment option now "Pay by credit card". Ignore the PayPal connection.


3ème étape / 3d step :


Entrez vos coordonnées pour le paiement. Attention de bien choisir votre pays car celui mis par défaut est les Etats Unis. Enfin, décochez la case Paypal si vous ne souhaitez pas enregistrer les informations sur PayPal.

Put your details for the payment. Pay attention to the choice of your country because the default choice is the USA. To finish, don't tick the PayPal case if you don't want to save your details on Pay Pal.


4ème étape / 4rth step :

Continuez, toujours sans vous connecter à Pay Pal.

Continue, without conecting to PayPal.


5ème étape / 5th step :

Cliquez sur "Payer" pour compléter votre contribution.

Click on "Pay" to complete your pledge.


Pour finir, si vous ne souhaitez pas contribuer, n'hésitez pas à parler de notre projet autour de vous !

neolid vous remercie !

To finish, if you don't wish to contribute, don't hesitate to spread the word about our project.

neolid thanks you !


Les contreparties / The rewards:


Pour la petite histoire :

Un jour d'août 2006 Nicolas Frolin, lassé de perdre son temps à chercher les couvercles de ses boîtes préférées, invente le concept de Boîte Étanche sans Couvercle. Sept ans et deux brevets plus tard sort le TWIZZ, la première application de ce concept. Ce mug étanche et isotherme sans couvercle (le tout premier !) a été inventé à la Croix-Rousse, à Lyon, et est fabriqué en Savoie (à Belmont-Tramonet). neolid choisit des fournisseurs et des partenaires de proximité dans un rayon de 150 kilomètres et assure ainsi la qualité et la sûreté de la fabrication française !

Pour cette année 2014, neolid a décidé de s’attaquer à un nouveau projet, celui de la BOX.

A little background:

It was a day of august 2006 when Nicolas Frolin, tired of wasting his time searching for the matching lids of his favorites boxes, invented the Lidless Sealed Box concept. Seven years and two patents later, the TWIZZ was released, the first real application of the concept. This lidless, sealed and insulated travel mug (the very first one!) was invented in Croix Rousse in the city of Lyon and is produced in the nearby area of Savoie (Belmont-Tramonet). Neolid has chosen local providers and partners in a surrounding of 150km around Lyon, to ensure the « made in France » quality and reliability!

In 2014, Neolid has decided to take on a new project: the BOX.


Qu’est-ce que la BOX ?

Eh bien c’est tout simplement une lunch box ! Simplement avez-vous dit ?  Pas tout à fait.

En effet, la Box tout comme son grand frère le TWIZZ (premier mug étanche sans couvercle), dispose d’un système de fermeture innovant, sans couvercle, qui lui garantit une étanchéité parfaite. Elle est dotée d’une membrane en silicone (1, repère sur le visuel) qui s’ouvre et se referme d’une simple rotation de sa bague (2, repère sur le visuel), à l’instar d’un diaphragme d’appareil photo. 

What is the BOX?

A simple lunch box is what it’s all about! Not quite, actually.

Indeed the BOX, as its big brother the TWIZZ (the first lidless sealed travel mug), includes an innovative lidless closing system which ensures a complete seal. The BOX features a silicon membrane (marked as 1 on the visual) which opens and closes thanks to a simple twist of its ring (marked as 2 on the visual), just like the lens of a camera would.

Not only is it sealed, this box is 100% airtight, which lets you store food in it with no concerns of it going bad.  And thanks to a removable shell which acts as a protection (marked as 3 on the visual), the BOX is insulated and makes it the perfect container to enjoy warm and cold meals in any situation.


Pourquoi l’avoir inventée ?

Pour éviter de chercher le couvercle ou pire, de le perdre. L’idée étant de faciliter la vie de l’utilisateur en proposant un « couvercle », en l’occurrence une membrane, directement incorporée à la lunch box. Ainsi, la présence de cette membrane élimine à la fois toute perte de temps liée à la recherche du couvercle et tout risque de perte, en assurant étanchéité et isothermie tout au long de la durée de vie du produit.

Why create it ?

To avoid wasting time looking for the matching lid or even losing it. The main idea is to facilitate the user’s life by offering a « lid ». In other words, it is a membrane directly embedded to the lunch box. Therefore, this special feature eliminates all risk of searching or losing the appropriate lid and it ensures a perfect seal and thermal isolation for the entire product shelf life.



Le concept du sans couvercle

Etonnant de simplicité et d’ingéniosité, ce système breveté assure fermeture et étanchéité par l’intermédiaire d’une membrane en torsion. Fixée en haut, sur une bague amovible mais aussi  en bas, sur le corps du produit, la membrane se vrille à mesure qu’on tourne la bague, sur le même principe que la fermeture d’un ballon de baudruche.

Ce concept signé neolid a désormais fait ses preuves par la commercialisation du TWIZZ, premier mug étanche sans couvercle, sorti le 14 juillet 2013 et compte bien perdurer et être décliné à plusieurs types d’utilisations.

Après la boisson, il est grand temps de l’étendre à la nourriture…Tel est le grand défi de la BOX. 

The no lid concept

Remarkably simple and clever, this patented system ensures closure and a perfect seal via a twisted membrane. With its upper side attached to a plastic turning ring, and its lower side attached to the mug itself, the membrane twists as you turn the ring.

This neolid branded concept has already proven itself with the TWIZZ, released on the market on July 14th 2013, and looks forward to even more successful uses.

Already used for beverages, it is now time to extend the concept to food… This is the big challenge of the BOX.

Voici les modèles actuels du TWIZZ ainsi qu’un mode d’emploi / Here are the current types of TWIZZ and an user guide :




Pourquoi le crowdfunding ?

Nous travaillons sur la conception du produit depuis bientôt 1 an, depuis la naissance de l’idée jusqu’à l’aboutissement à un prototype fonctionnel, en passant par les différents tests et réajustement techniques. Il est désormais temps pour nous de franchir le pas pour arriver à sa finalisation et envisager sa production. Pour cela, nous avons cependant besoin de votre soutien et c’est pour cette raison que nous avons choisi la plateforme Indiegogo.

En effet, sans votre aide la BOX ne pourra pas accompagner votre quotidien et vous suivre au gré de vos voyages, activités et autres déplacements. D’autre part, nous souhaitons profiter de vos idées et autres suggestions pour déboucher sur un produit fini qui répond pleinement à vos attentes. Le succès se construit ensemble, nous comptons sur vous.

Why the crowdfunding ?

We have been working on the project for almost 1 year now, from the basic idea to the outcome of a working prototype. It’s now time for us to take the next step and consider its final tweaks and its production. In order to do that, your support is fundamental and that is why we have chosen Indiegogo.

Indeed, without your help the BOX will not be a part of your everyday life and accompany you in all your travels and other activities. And we would also be very grateful to gather your ideas and suggestions to make a final product that better suits your needs and expectations. The success is build together, we rely on you.


A quoi vos contributions seront-t-elles destinées ?

Vos contributions nous aiderons à couvrir des coûts inhérents au développement et à la production du produit fini.

How will your funding be spent?

They will help us cover the costs linked to the development and the release of the final product.

En détail / Here are the details:

Planning / Schedule


Les contreparties / The rewards :

·  1er pallier, 7€ / 9,50$: « Paye ton coup ! »

Votre nom apparaîtra sur notre « Wall of Fame », le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit neolid, le nom de notre société (photo à l’appui). Vous recevrez également un autocollant où sera inscrit le slogan de la BOX ainsi qu’un porte clé décapsuleur neolid. 

·  1st perk, 7€ / 9,50$: « It's on me! »

Your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company (photo as a proof). You’ll also receive a sticker with the BOX slogan and a neolid branded bottle opener keychain.


·  2ème pallier, 18€ / 24,50$ : « Le TWIZZ édition spéciale Indiegogo ! »

Vous recevrez un TWIZZ édition spéciale pour l’occasion du projet. Votre nom apparaîtra sur notre « Wall of Fame », le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit neolid, le nom de notre société (photo à l’appui)

* Ajouter 5,95€ / 8$ de ports pour un envoi dans l’UE ou en Suisse et 7,95€ / 11$ pour un envoi hors UE et Suisse. 

·  2nd perk, 18€ / 24,50$: « The TWIZZ Indiegogo special edition! »

You’ll get a special edition of the TWIZZ branded with our Indiegogo campaign. Your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company (photo as a proof).

* Add 5,95€ / 8$ shipping fees for Switzerland and the EU and 7,95€ / 11$ for other countries, outside of the EU and Switzerland.


·  3ème pallier, 25€ / 34$ : « Ta première BOX »

Vous recevrez une BOX en décembre 2014 et votre nom apparaîtra sur notre « Wall of Fame », le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit neolid, le nom de notre société (photo à l’appui).

* Ajouter 5,95€ / 8$ de ports pour un envoi dans l’UE ou en Suisse et 7,95€ / 11$ pour un envoi hors UE et Suisse.

·  3rd perk, 25€ / 34$: « Your first BOX »

You’ll receive a BOX in December 2014 and your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company (photo as a proof).

* Add 5,95€ / 8$ shipping fees for Switzerland and the EU and 7,95€ / 11$ for other countries, outside of the EU and Switzerland.


·  4ème pallier, 40€ / 54$ : « Coup double ! »

Vous recevrez deux BOXen décembre 2014 et votre nom apparaîtra sur notre « Wall of Fame », le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit neolid, le nom de notre société (photo à l’appui).

* Ajouter 9,95 € / 13,5$ de ports pour un envoi dans l’UE ou en Suisse et 10,95 € / 15$ pour un envoi hors UE et Suisse. 

·  4th perk, 40€/54$: « Double shot! »

You’ll get two BOXes in December 2014 and your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company (photo as a proof).

* Add 9,95€ / 13,5$ shipping fees for Switzerland and the EU and 10,95€ / 15$ for other countries, outside of the EU and Switzerland.


·  5ème pallier, 100€ / 136$ « Le gros lot! » 

Vous recevrez un TWIZZ édition spéciale en avril 2014 ainsi qu’une BOX en décembre. Votre nom apparaîtra sur notre « Wall of Fame » », le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit neolid, le nom de notre société (photo à l’appui). Vous recevrez également un autocollant où sera inscrit le slogan de la BOX ainsi qu’un porte clé décapsuleur neolid. De plus, vous endosserez un rôle de consultant dans le développement et le design de la BOX.  

* Pour le TWIZZ en avril, ajouter 5,95€ / 8$ de ports pour un envoi dans l’UE ou en Suisse et 7,95€ / 11$ pour un envoi hors UE et Suisse.

* Pour la BOX en décembre, ajouter  5,95€ / 8$ de ports pour un envoi dans l’UE ou en Suisse et 7,95€ / 11$ pour un envoi hors UE et Suisse.

·  5th perk, 100€ / 136$: « The big deal! »

You’ll get a special edition of the TWIZZ branded with our Indiegogo campaign in April 2014 and a BOX in December. Your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company (photo as a proof). You’ll also get a sticker with the BOX slogan and a neolid branded bottle opener keychain. Moreover, you’ll have a consulting role in the design and development of the BOX.

*For the TWIZZ in April, add 5,95€ / 8$ shipping fees for Switzerland and the EU and 7,95€ / 11$ for other countries, outside the EU and Switzerland.

*For the BOX in December, add 5,95€ / 8$ shipping fees for Switzerland and the EU and 7,95€ / 11$ for other countries, outside the EU and Switzerland.


·  6 ème pallier, 500€ / 680$ : « A la rencontre de la BOX !»

Partez à la découverte de la BOX et du TWIZZ, lors d’un week end « all incusive » (hébergement et repas compris) à Lyon pour deux personnes le 14 juillet 2014, à l’occasion des 1 ans du TWIZZ. Vous rencontrerez les membres de l’équipe neolid et aurez l’occasion de partager un repas avec eux. Vous découvrirez également nos locaux basés à Lyon Croix Rousse. De plus, vous recevrez un TWIZZ « édition spéciale », une BOX, ainsi qu’un auto avec le slogan de la BOX et un porte clé décapsuleur neolid. Enfin, votre nom apparaîtra au « Wall of Fame » le mur dans nos bureaux où est inscrit Neolid, le nom de notre société que vous aurez l’occasion de voir en vrai.

·  6th perk, 500€ / 680$: « Let’s meet the BOX! »

Time to discover the BOX and the TWIZZ through an all inclusive (lodging and meals included) week end in Lyon for 2 on July 14th2014, for the TWIZZ release anniversary. You’ll meet the neolid’s team members and enjoy a meal with them.  You will also discover our headquarters based in La Croix Rousse, in Lyon. Moreover, you’ll get a special edition TWIZZ branded with our Indiegogo campaign, a BOX, a sticker with the BOX slogan and a neolid branded bottle opener keychain. Finally, your name will be mentioned on our « Wall of Fame », the wall in our headquarters on which is written neolid, the name of our company, which you’ll visit in person! 


Notre équipe / Our team



Où nous trouver ? / Where to find us ?

- Inscrivez-vous à notre newsletter / Suscribe to our newsletter : http://www.neolid.com/blog/

- Likez sur Facebook / Like on Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/Neolid1?ref=ts&fref=ts

- Suivez-nous sur Twitter / Follow us on Twitter : https://twitter.com/neolid1

- Téléchargez notre dossier de presse / Download our press kit : http://www.neolid.com/blog/espace-presse/

- Visionnez notre chaine Youtube / See us on Youtube : http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHA9OOd3cip1ajsMw9LI7Uw 

- Visitez notre site / Visit our web site : http://www.neolid.com/

story:
The power plant

Inspired by bonsaï trees and fractal patterns found in nature, Electree mini provides solar-derived power to environments typically void of renewable energy.


Origin


I had the first idea about the Electree mini in 2007, shortly after my graduation in design. One year later, in order to find a job I decided to illustrate this concept and put it on internet. I did not expect such an enthusiasm for this product. Many journalist contacted me and demand was big.

  • "Solar Tree Concept Is the World's Best Looking Solar Gadget Charger" - Gizmodo
  • "Definitely a decorative way to go green!" - Yanko Design
  • "a delightful plant that requires no watering and sustains your gadgets by harnessing the power of the sun" - inhabitat
  • "the modular nature of the design allows the user to model the tree as they prefer" - designboom

But I had no idea where to begin, and it took me 3 years to find someone to help me develop and manufacture the Electree.

  • "A concept debuted by Muller a few years back, and we've wanted it ever since" - Gizmodo
  • "It is a perfect combination of aesthetics, ecology and functionality" - CrazyEngineers
  • "Finally, a bonsai tree that uses solar power to charge your gadgets" - Engadget
  • "I say we start a Facebook page begging for more to be made available" - Geeksugar

Then I dedicated 2 years to create Electree mini. Except for electronic components, which are handled by a professional electronic engineer, I personally developed every aspect of the product.

 

 

  solar cells


One of the most important component on this product is obviously photovoltaic cells.

I have no other option than to provide the best quality available.

That’s why I choose to use PowerFilm’s lightweight, thin, flexible solar panels, not only for aesthetic but to guaranty a tougher leaf and a more powerful product.

PowerFilm is a global solar technology company located in Ames, Iowa, USA, that manufactures flexible solar modules with a thin film plastic substrate.


Perks

batteries not included

  • Electree Mini stores solar energy in small batteries. You can use them directly to power your appliances, like a remote control.

  • Electree + LED turns your solar tree into a color changing lantern. It’s completely autonomous, since solar cells are light sensors, the module will automatically light up at dusk. To change color, you just have to rotate the Electree mini.


  • Electree + USB will provide a 1A standard USB port. If you live in a sunny country, you’ll be able to recharge your smartphone everyday. Electree mini is also a formidable companion for your smart watch, even with a cloudy weather you'll always be able to recharge it.

  • If the campaign is successful, I’ll develop other modules. For example I’d love to offer you a bluetooth speaker or a webcam etc…


I need your help to make the Electree mini affordable, high quality, and available to the world.

Except for the solar cells, all the parts are produced in France.    

I prepared everything to keep factories close and thus ensure a constant quality check all along the manufacturing process.

But I can't do this without you!


Contribute on behalf of a friend or loved one to give the unparalleled, extraordinary, and utterly unforgettable gift of the Electree mini.

Or reserve an Electree mini for your home, office, or store, to ensure continuous aesthetic rapture coupled with a greener carbon footprint for yourself and all your visitors, colleagues, and customers.


Featured on


Frequently Asked Questions


How many times will it take to recharge my phone?

Many parameters must be taken in account: exposure to direct sunlight, capacity of batteries etc…

With the USB module your appliances will charge as quickly as usual, because you’re just transferring stored energy from the batteries.


Will my Electree mini be able to recharge my tablet/iPad?

No, photovoltaic technology is not powerful enough yet.


Why is the first Electree not available anymore?

It was a very limited edition, 300 specimens. 

I stopped the production because I wasn’t satisfied by the quality of the Chinese factory.


Why is it so expensive ?

The tooling for plastic injection is very costly. Electree mini is manufactured in France in order to provide the best quality, but it’s also a bit more expensive. This is how your money will be spent:


What happened with the Electree+ campaign on another crowdfunding website?

It was a scam.

Someone stole my identity and I actually pressed charges.

A fake Google+ account and e-mail was enough to set up the fraud. The two other individuals that curated the content for the KS campaign were unaware of the identity theft until I messaged them.

To date I have no personal Facebook / Twitter / Google + account.


Can I place my Electree mini outdoor?

Yes! You will harvest much more energy. But be careful, you must avoid heavy rain.


What is it made of?

Mainly ABS plastic & Polycarbonate, which are highly recyclable. There’s not a single drop of glue inside the Electree mini, you can disassemble it very easily.

story:
We want to create the easiest, most affordable way to bring voice control to your home.  We decided to start with Z-Wave as it has the largest, most diverse, most stable ecosystem of products and manufacturers of any home control technology.  As ZLINK grows we likely will add other technologies such as Bluetooth, BLE and Mesh, but only where it adds to something missing in Z-Wave, like beacons.  We started with Amazon Alexa as our first Smart Home Assistant.  Alexa is the most developed and stable voice assistant currently available. We would like to add others such as Google Home, HomeKit and Invoke over time but this depends on your funding (see stretch goals).

We are using this campaign to help produce the ZLINK Hub.  Unlike other bloated hubs with multiple protocols we are only supporting two; Z-Wave for home control and WiFi for connection to the cloud, App and Alexa.  We are keeping it simple with the initial focus on in-home voice control of devices such as lighting, thermostats, and locks.  Over time, we will add more devices and a fully featured, Internet-based, remote experience.  Our target cost for the ZLINK Hub is under $20.00. 

As ZLINK grows we will expand the system using small inexpensive Hubs and Servers, keeping the system modular and simple, never forcing you to buy more than you need. Of course, we will keep everything under one user experience.

Because we have been heavily involved in the industry helping others bring products to market we have the know-how to source some of the best, least expensive end devices to complement the ZLINK Hub. We are starting with a few of the most popular; plug-in switch and dimmer and in-wall switch and dimmer and have included these fully featured, proven designs in some starter kits with the ZLINK Hub. We will use some of the campaign funds to help with the certifications and packaging required to bring these deals to you.

Who is ZLINK?

ZLINK, conceived and executed by industry experts with deep experience in Home Control, Building Management, and Independent Living, exists to bring to market high-value, innovative solutions that complement the existing field of Certified Z-Wave products. ZLINK will create new products when necessary to complete solutions and will bring new technologies and device types to market. To learn more please visit www.zlinkproducts.com 

What is the ZLINK Hub?

ZLINK starts with the ZLINK Smart Home Hub. This super-affordable hub allows you to easily add voice control for devices like lighting, thermostats, door locks.  

The heart of ZLINK is a revolutionary low-cost hub that is self-contained, powered by any USB power supply that allows you to voice control your home automation devices via Amazon Echo. Don’t let the compact USB form fool you- this device runs even when your computer is shut down, like any other smart hub. However, the ZLINK platform is expandable and super easy to set up, with no monthly bills!

Swivel 180 degrees for flexible installation

Plug-In Anywhere

USB 5V power supply

USB behind TV

USB outlet

USB on router

Will the ZLINK Smart Home Hub work with any Amazon Alexa device?


Yes, for under $20, the ZLINK Smart Home Hub is meant to be a companion to any Alexa assistant and will give you voice control of your Z-Wave devices with whatever Amazon Echo product you purchase.  The ZLINK hub also works with smartphone apps and has a web application as well. 

ZLINK is more than just the hub!

The ZLINK Smart Home Hub is the center of your smart home.  The ZLINK hub allows your Amazon Alexa to talk to and control your Z-Wave products.  We started with Z-Wave as it is the best home automation technology on the market. As ZLINK grows we will likely add other technologies such as Bluetooth (BLE and Mesh), where needed.  We started with Amazon Alexa as our first Smart Home Assistant but don’t plan to stop there. ZLINK is not just another hub and will expand to be unlike anything else.

What is Z-Wave? What makes it the best?


The best smart home products use a technology called Z-Wave. It is our choice, as Z-Wave offers over 2100 products from 600 companies. This gives you, the customer, a great selection and lowest price point for a whole host of devices. Z-Wave is safe, secure, robust, and the leading technology for home control products. 

Who else uses Z-Wave?

Z-Wave is used by many of the top home automation and security companies, and more options are being added every day. ADT, AT&T, Verizon, SmartThings, WINK, and Ring Protect, and many more use Z-Wave products for their smart home solutions.

What does ZLINK work with?

Because it has the interoperability of Z-Wave technology the ZLINK hub will work with most certified Z-Wave devices*. We have offered two easy starter packages as part of this IndieGoGo campaign to get you started.  

*Not all Z-Wave device types will be supported as launch.  We are focusing on lighting, thermostats, door locks and simples sensors such as door/window, motion, and temperature. More device types will be added post-launch via over the air updates. 

Devices in the kit

Plug-In Switch:

Plug in Dimmer:

In Wall On/Off Switch:

In Wall Dimmer:

What are you going to do with the money raised during this IndieGoGo campaign?

We are going to use the funds raised from Indiegogo to partially fund the manufacture, marketing, and distribution of the ZLINK Smart Home Hub and ZLINK Pro and Plug n Play kits.

What do I get for becoming a part of this IndieGoGo campaign?

As an early adopter, we will give you discounts on an already incredibly affordable Amazon Alexa companion.

Rewards

Early Bird

IndieGoGo Special

What people are saying

 

"Besides the sheer volume of interoperable products, Z-Wave offers some significant features that ZigBee does not. First is security. Today Z-Wave, with its S2 security framework, is the only mesh-networking protocol UL-approved for life-safety applications.  . .  There are numerous benefits for using UL-certified mesh-networking communications for security.”   "The second thing is SmartStart, a new feature for "pre-configuring devices in the cloud so they can 'just connect' at the customer premises." (Found on CEPro's website, click here)

- Julie Jacobson · October 17, 2017

Stretch Goals

When we reach our initial goal of $50,000 and have completed the application to Amazon for the "Works with Alexa" certification we will  start working on working on integration with Google Home Assistant.

Timeline

story:
Everything deserves a place to rest...

Now your most prized possession has a place to unwind, a bed to sleep in, a spot to call home.

Presenting dBed for the Apple iPhone and iPod Touch.

Colours available

Features

• Elegant design, durable construction

• Cut outs on both sides for easy handling

• Compatable with both Apple lightning and 30 pin connectors

• Perfectly weighted and balanced

• Premium material with a rubbery feel

Why the dBed?

• You will always know where your phone is by dedicating a bed for it on your desk

• You will help prevent scratches by avoiding placing your phone on the hard surface of a desk. Instead, it will be safely resting in its bed

• You will be able to read messages and notifications without having to pick up the phone

Your support will allow us to bring to market a useful and innovative product that is sure to be a feature on your desk for years to come.

We are seeking funds to aid with the cost of creation of the mould, the buying of product materials as well as to cover the cost of various colours to enrich and fill the product with life.

 

 

 

Shipping

• United States: $15 (up to 3 dBeds)

• United Kingdom: $18 (up to 3 dBeds)

• Australia: $10 (up to 3 dBeds)

• International/Other: Contact Us for pricing

***Do not forget to add shipping to the total amount of your pledge***

story:
As featured in: 

See our website for more. 

We have launched our referral program!

For every ROOT that is bought through your campaign link share, you will receive $30 off!


ROOT brings the farm to your table.



ROOT is a space-efficient, easy-to-use gardening system that can grow up to 16 vegetables, herbs or flowers. All you need to do is plug in and sync ROOT then add water, plants and nutrients. You’re ready to grow!

Have you ever harvested your own fresh produce before? Perhaps you've tried and were unsuccessful. Maybe you don't believe you have the space or time to grow anything. With ROOT you can now grow seamlessly without having to weed or water.

Nothing can compare to the fresh taste or health benefits of eating straight from your own garden. ROOT will connect you with your food.

ROOT allows you to grow in any environment


ROOT contains an automated smart LED lighting and watering system that takes care of your plants for you. ROOT grows hydroponically – without soil. This means faster and more efficient plant growth without the mess. ROOT's sensors are integrated to adjust to lighting in your environment. Your plants will grow in small containers called ROOT Pods that hold your plants' roots in place. Additionally, our app will sync with your ROOT so you receive notifications and alerts when your ROOT needs water or nutrients.

Syncs with your life

The app allows you to control the light system - if you go to bed at 9PM, you can program ROOT to sleep with you. Our app also syncs with ROOT's sensors to remind you when water or nutrients are running low.


What can I grow?

ROOT will grow a variety of plants, vegetables and herbs.

  • Lettuce: Watercress, Romaine, Butter, Boston
  • Leafy Greens: Swiss Chard, Kale, Mustard Greens
  • Leafy Herbs: Basil, Cilantro, Parsley, Mint
  • Woody Herbs: Rosemary, Thyme, Oregano
  • Vine Plants: Cherry & Grape Tomatoes, Small Hot Peppers
  • Edible Flowers: Chamomile, Wild Flowers 

From our farm to yours

We will be offering ROOT Shares – a seedling subscription service that allows you to jump-start your gardening. These kits will include all your favorite varieties in addition to rare heirloom and organic specialties.

Why grow your own?


Our organically grown produce guarantees quality and taste unmatched by what's found in a grocery store. Harvesting straight from the plant provides you the easiest access to the freshest produce Hydroponic growing has traditionally utilized chemically derived substrates and nutrients - but we have all natural solutions. Your produce will provide maximum nutrient content, all within arms reach! Additionally, by growing your own you are reducing your environmental impact.

Our mission is to connect people to their food sources.

Everyone needs to eat, and Ohneka Farms believes that access to fresh produce is a fundamental right. We've been working with communities to jump start urban gardens in food deserts where people do not have direct access to organic produce. In particular. We are working with the EVOLVE Foundation to apply our technology to hydroponic gardens in Philadelphia food deserts. 

We want to create sustainable solutions that allow people to grow their own produce, fostering deeper connections with food and bringing families and communities together.

We want to increase everyone's access to organic produce and attack systemic food issues. A lack of space, light or growing knowledge should not prevent anyone from growing. We created our own solution to organic growing because we were tired of inefficient growing alternatives and poorly designed consumer products.

Ecology is the design.

We are implementing a "Cradle to Cradle" approach to our design and manufacturing processes. This means we have committed to using socially-minded, sustainable methods to support waste-free, regenerative systems during all stages of the product lifecycle.

Designed with you in mind


We are creating products that establish lifelong connections between people and their food. From simple pruning to transplanting, ROOT is great for novice and expert gardeners alike. We have worked directly with individuals in the R&D phase to ensure we can meet a user's personal growing needs. 

Americans throw away an estimated 64% of produce in this country. This waste plagues every step of the supply chain – from farmers discarding blemished produce to retail stores overstocking product displays to end consumers tossing away uneaten food.

Our story

Founders Eric and Brielle met in the Integrated Product Design Masters program at The University of Pennsylvania. The two were both interested in urban agricultural design and decided to join forces to continue their lifelong passion for growing. After school, they built an organic microfarm together where they currently test their organic permaculture growing methodologies. Tired of devising workarounds to inefficient growing systems, they designed their own solution. They have built out an interdisciplinary team whose skill sets and backgrounds entwine technology, biology and art to make ecology the focus of our smart design.


What are the next steps & challenges?

We have been working on ROOT for more than three years, researching and developing the technology and performing user testing. We worked with novice and expert gardeners, researchers and physicians to improve our product. Our next step is to get our prototype ready for production.  Our product is now patent pending, and we have been working with our engineers and manufacturing partners to refine the design for production.


Manufacturing: 

We need to create the tooling to manufacture the body of ROOT. This process is complex and requires both time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. We are working with experienced partners who can work closely with us through the whole process. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you and deliver it to you on time.

FAQ

What is hydroponic gardening?

Hydroponic gardening is a form of growing plants using mineral nutrient solutions in water without soil. This ensures that plants receive nutrients directly into their roots. Using a controlled environment, plants receive the proper care that allows them to grow efficiently.

How much power does ROOT consume?

ROOT consumes 40 watts of power - the equivalent of just one standard incandescent lightbulb!

What is Cradle to Cradle manufacturing?

"Cradle to Cradle" is a term used in product development to describe manufacturing processes that are essentially waste free. This process mimics nature in the sense that all material inputs and outputs are seen as "nutrients." The nutrients can be recycled or reused with no loss of quality to the material input. Those nutrients go back into the stream.

How do I assemble ROOT?

ROOT is simple and easy to assemble:

  1. Fill the reservoir with water and nutrients
  2. Place the body on the reservoir
  3. Snap the lamp onto the top
  4. Plug in and sync ROOT

You're ready to grow!

What is included in my ROOT Kit?

ROOT comes with:

  • 16 ROOT Pods (plant containers)
  • 1 ROOT Share (16 seed starters)
  • Nutrient Solution

How big is ROOT?

ROOT is 26'' tall and 12'' wide.

How do I maintain my ROOT?

Between each growing cycle, the ROOT reservoir is easily removable to access for cleaning. Simply empty and rinse out the reservoir, remove your old plants, fill with fresh water and plant your new seeds.

How is ROOT different than other hydroponic products on the market?

ROOT has the ability to grow a wide variety of herbs and vegetables within small or cramped spaces. It is a plug-and-play system that has all the integrated components you need to start growing:  lights, timers, and a self-watering system.  ROOT's aesthetic integrates seamlessly into your life.

Root features:

  • More plants per square foot than comparable growing units
  • Fits on a countertop, tabletop, closet or floor
  • Adaptable to any lifestyle

Why are LEDs used?

LEDs are more efficient and use less energy than standard grow lights. Traditional growing lights produce light that flows in every direction, wasting light energy and dissipating a large amount of heat. LEDs focus specific wavelengths of lights that can be readily absorbed by plants, minimizing the amount of energy required to supply proper lighting. Fewer resources are used in LED manufacturing, which does not use mercury or lead.

Is shipping included in my contribution?

If you are in the US or Canada, shipping is included in your contribution. If you are outside of the US or Canada, please add $60 USD to your contribution for international shipping.

Will ROOT come in different colors?

We are currently focusing our efforts in manufacturing setup costs and tooling. Therefore, we will initially launch ROOT in an undyed, light grey plastic.

Is it safe to consume foods grown in recycled plastic?

Yes, recycled Polypropylene plastics are safe for growing your plants. Many conventional farms grow food using this material. Common harmful additives, such as BPA, are removed during the recycling process. By using plastic, we are keeping this material from piling up in landfills, while simultaneously reducing carbon emissions.

Thank you for reading our story!

Stay in touch and sign up for our newsletter for product updates. We hope to hear from you soon!
story_txt:
As featured in: See our website for more. We have launched our referral program!For every ROOT that is bought through your campaign link share, you will receive $30 off!ROOT brings the farm to your table.

ROOT is a space-efficient, easy-to-use gardening system that can grow up to 16 vegetables, herbs or flowers. All you need to do is plug in and sync ROOT then add water, plants and nutrients. You’re ready to grow!
Have you ever harvested your own fresh produce before? Perhaps you've tried and were unsuccessful. Maybe you don't believe you have the space or time to grow anything. With ROOT you can now grow seamlessly without having to weed or water.
Nothing can compare to the fresh taste or health benefits of eating straight
from your own garden. ROOT will connect you with your food.
ROOT allows you to grow in any environment

ROOT contains an automated smart LED lighting and watering system that takes care of your plants for you. ROOT grows hydroponically – without soil. This means faster and more efficient plant growth without the mess. ROOT's sensors are integrated to adjust to lighting in your environment. Your plants will grow in small containers called ROOT Pods that hold your plants' roots in place. Additionally, our app will sync with your ROOT so you receive notifications and alerts when your ROOT needs water or nutrients.

Syncs with your life
The app allows you to control the light system - if you go to bed at 9PM, you can program ROOT to sleep with you. Our app also syncs with ROOT's sensors to remind you when water or nutrients are running low.


What can I grow?
ROOT will grow a variety of plants, vegetables and herbs.

story:
Watch the video above(↑), then read what follows below(↓).

What is a FastFlow Lid?

The FastFlow Lid is a disposable cup lid for runners that allows them to drink quickly and easily without slowing, choking, or spilling.  Just like the name suggests - it flows fast.

The combination of the vent and the smooth high-flow spout enables the liquid to be delivered quickly, but without the mess.

Why do you need a FastFlow Lid?

Or maybe we should ask, "Why wouldn't you want a FastFlow Lid?"  Unless you really like spilling sports drinks on your shirt, up your nose, or in your eyes, you'll absolutely love this new product.

The runners that have used the FastFlow Lids rave about them.  Their biggest disappointment is that the lids are not yet provided in all their races.  Many runners said they don't want to run another race without them.

The FastFlow Lids aren't just useful for running.  They're great for any cold drink on the go - soft drinks, milk shakes, frozen drinks, etc. 

The FastFlow Lid is great for people of all ages - from young to old, and everyone in between.  Why?  Because it makes drinking easier, especially when you're on the move.  Consider the following times where this lid would also help:

  • Movie Theaters
  • Sports Arenas
  • Fast Food Restaurants
  • Zoos
  • Amusement Parks
  • Cafeterias

FastFlow Lids can easily replace all slotted lids with straws.  This evolution in the disposable cold drink cup lid will reduce waste and lower the cost since straws are no longer needed.  That's better for the environment and it's better for the user because it's just easier to drink with the FastFlow Lid than it is to suck through a straw.  If you don't believe us, just try it with your next smoothie.

Help us help you!

In order to produce the lids at an affordable price, we need to use production tooling that is much larger than the four-cavity tool we have used so far.   With enough help, we'll be able to fulfill orders for larger races, and you can start demanding the FastFlow Lids at all of your upcoming races.

This lid design has a patent pending.  Since there really isn't any other lid on the market that works like the FastFlow Lid, you won't be able to get anything like it without us bringing it to you.  But, we'll need your help to get this product into your race(s).  If you will help us get this project off the ground and running, we'll help you enjoy running events a little more by making the task of hydrating enjoyable once again.

What others are saying about FastFlow Lids

FastFlow Lids have been very well-received.  Those that have only seen them love the concept.  And those who have used them want to use them in their next race.  Here's just a small sampling of what people are saying:

  • "They were AWESOME!...Can't wait to see them at more races!" - Meg D.
  • "This is a great product, and I hope it catches on with more races.  It’s a lot better than crossing the finish line a drooly mess." - Matt R.
  • “I’m not even a marathoner, and I want to use this.” - Rex W.
  • “This would benefit everyone – car trips, parties, sports events, hospitals, etc.” - Susan A.

The FastFlow Lid product concept was also chosen (by judges and the audience) as the first 2012 winner of the 5across competition, an innovative pitch contest for entrepreneurs.

We're anxious to get this product into your hands so you can experience them for yourself.  This Indiegogo project is your opportunity to make that happen.

Perks

Perks are what we give you when you choose to fund our project.  We are offering two different types of perks.  The first is black and/or white FastFlow Lids.

The second type of perk is the one-of-a-kind decal – “26.21875 - Because it's not a marathon until you conquer the last 99 feet!™”.  Did you know that 26.2 miles is not a complete marathon?  The official distance is 26.2 miles plus 99 feet, which is exactly 26.21875 miles.  Often the last 99 feet is the hardest part of the marathon.  Click on the decal picture below to see Wade conquer his last 99 feet in an attempt to qualify for the Boston Marathon.

We are offering two types of perk categories with the following perk levels:

FastFlow Lids (Estimated Delivery - Dec. 2012)

  • $15 – 10 white or black lids (or any ratio)
  • $20 – 10 white & 10 black lids
  • $30 – 15 white & 15 black lids, 30 cups
  • $49 – 50 white & 50 black lids, 100 cups
  • $199 – 200 white & 200 black lids, 400 cups, Gatorade mix
  • $599 – 1,200 white & 1,200 black lids, 2,400 cups
  • $999 – 4,000 white & 4,000 black lids
  • $9,999 – 80,000 white or black lids (or any ratio)

Oval Decals: "26.21875 - Because it's not a marathon until you conquer the last 99 feet!(TM)" (Estimated Delivery - Oct. 2012)

  • $5 – One oval decal Bumper Sticker ($199 for 50 stickers)
  • $8 – One oval decal Window Cling ($299 for 50 clings)
  • $10 – One Magnetic oval decal ($399 for 50 magnets)

FastFlow Lids are designed to fit the Gatorade brand 12 oz. cold cup (made by Solo Cup).

Thank you for supporting the FastFlow Lid project.  This project would not be possible without you.

Make Your Race Stand Out with FastFlow Lids

RunTheBluegrass Half Marathon in Lexington, Kentucky (a beautiful course, by the way) was the first organized race to use the FastFlow Lids.  They purchased 3,000 lids, which was enough for two of their eleven hydration stations.

Race organizers of RunTheBluegrass saw such a benefit from providing these lids to their runners that they committed to order more for their next race.

Be the first race in your state to provide FastFlow Lids to your runners at every hydration station.  You'll be glad you did it.

At the race expo before the RunTheBluegrass Half Marathon, we showed hundreds of runners the FastFlow Lids and told them they were "lids that allowed a runner to drink easily and quickly without slowing or spilling."  On average, the runners we surveyed were willing to pay $3.40 more for their race fees if the race offered the lids at all hydrations stations.

After the race, we surveyed runners again.  The increase in race fees they were willing to pay went up to $7.40 on average.  So what does this mean?  The customer value clearly exceeds the cost, and the lids will not only pay for themselves, they'll also make your race more desirable.

FAQ's

Are FastFlow Lids recyclable?

  • Yes, they are 100% recyclable.  The lids are made from food-grade polystyrene plastic and use recycling number 6.

Why are the FastFlow Lids produced in two different colors?

  • The white lids are used to indicate water is in the cup, while the black lids indicate that a sports drink is in the cup.  These colors can be seen from a distance, which informs runners well in advance what type of liquid they are getting at the hydration station.

Won't FastFlow Lids just cause more waste?

  • Our experience has shown that these lids actually cause less waste.  Because there are no splashes or spills, runners that typically take multiple cups at hydration stations will now only need to grab one cup.  The runners can hydrate well with one cup since they’re not spilling any of the liquid all over the front of their shirts.  This results in less cups needed at each hydration station, and therefore less water or sports drink that would have otherwise ended up on the road.  Furthermore, the lids can and should be fully recycled.

Are there different styles of lids?

  • Yes, there are two different FastFlow Lid designs.  The version featured in this Indiegogo project uses a unique venting system that prevents liquid from splashing in the face of the user.  As shown in a picture above, the vent is located under the rim of the lid.  This venting system is best suited for runners.  The second FastFlow Lid design has a vent through the top of the lid.  This particular design may be better suited for the consumer market.

What cup size does the FastFlow Lid fit?

  • The FastFlow Lid is designed to fit the Gatorade brand 12 oz. cold cup (made by Solo Cup).  FastFlow Lids should fit any standard 12 oz. paper cold cup, but if you’re not using the 12 oz. Gatorade cup, we suggest that before buying all of your cups you test the fit with the specific cup first.

Won't this take more time for volunteers to put lids on cups at races?

  • Yes, it will take just a little more time for hydration station volunteers to put lids on cups, but not much more.  Volunteers want to help and are willing to do more if it benefits the runners.  So, if volunteers start preparing cups and lids just a little earlier, they will be ready to go when the runners arrive.  Alternatively, adding an extra volunteer or two at the station will also do the trick.

Can cups with FastFlow Lids be stacked on top of each other for large races?

  • Yes, cups with FastFlow Lids can be stacked in several layers with a thin supporting material (such as cardboard or poster board) used between layers.  There is a clip in the video above showing cups and lids stacked on a hydration station table.

What other benefits do FastFlow Lids offer runners?

  • FastFlow Lids reduce congestion at hydration stations because they make the drink handoff quick and easy.  This allows runners to save precious time.  The more congested and slippery a hydration station is, the more likely an accident will occur.  However, FastFlow Lids prevent spills in the handoff and while drinking on the run, and prevent the road from becoming wet and slippery, or even icy.
  • Another benefit of the FastFlow Lids is that they keep contaminants (bugs, leaves, dirt, etc.) out of the drink before they're handed to the runners.  They also keep hydration station workers’ fingers out of the drink.

Why would I want to incur the cost of having FastFlow Lids in my race?

  • Runners that have used FastFlow Lids absolutely love them.  In fact, runners are asking for them in other races.  Based on runner survey results, races can raise their fees at least $5 if they communicate that they will provide FastFlow Lids at all their hydration stations.  Providing FastFlow Lids is a great way to attract more runners while also increasing race proceeds.

Who are the company founders?

  • Wade Powell and Geoff Carlson are the co-founders of Cornerstone Innovations, LLC - a company committed to developing products that make life easier.
  • Wade has 17 years of product development experience and has worked at various consumer electronics and medical device companies. Wade holds a bachelors degree in mechanical engineering from Utah State University and a masters degree in Engineering Management from Stanford University.
  • Geoff has 12 years of experience in the consumer electronics industry. Geoff holds bachelors and masters degrees in mechanical engineering from Brigham Young University.
  • With more than a dozen patents to our name, and others pending, we are passionate about creating value for the customer through innovative, yet elegantly simple, solutions. We both have had a life-long fascination with product development and spend much of our spare time developing products that solve common, everyday problems.
