story:
Life Simplified

It was always better to use water to clean everything from things in the house like dishes, clothes, floor and many other household things and we have always used in the bathroom soap, shampoo or conditioner for personal cleaning and for the toilet the traditional Roll paper, does not always leave us clean and comfortable.

Besides the economic expense and the discomfort of being changing the roll or getting the right one in quality, quantity or smoothness and we are never satisfied with the results.

That is why we have designed the most efficient and easy to use appliance and installation, which will not take more than 20 minutes to install.

Manufactured 100% stainless steel with mobile parts that will last for years without giving you more maintenance than the daily cleaning.

 

 

The Approach... Me and USA


I have had the opportunity to be in the United States on vacations and I have noticed that they only have the toilet without the system that is in my country for personal hygiene, they only use the roll of paper or just when they take a shower for the Intimate cleansing.

Try to make a universal model that works in any toilet in the world and that is definitely easy to use by children to older people obtaining the satisfaction generated by the use of water. With an efficient design in the consumption of water. And considerably saving the use of paper roll and money.

story:
This cool and pretty gadget gives you great feelings at home. 

Beautiful music when the lamp's levitating

When you're in deep sleep, it gives tenderest light.

A most adorable lighting device and decoration in your study room. 

Rest and yoga by its light and the music it plays.  

 

Why We Made It?

We're students from different countries and major in industrial design in part time. By chance we met each other and made this innovative lamp with support of schools and cooperation company.

We've seen a pretty levitating lamp on this platform and our friend just backed the project and got one. But she likes listening to some soothing music before sleep. So she got herself a Bluetooth speaker to connect to her mobile for playing music. 

Then we came to realize that why not making one item for these two functions - light and speaker. So we went wild in trials and at last, we did it! 

Made into the shape of a flower bud or an egg, it symbols hope. With the help of schools and cooperative organizations, we eventually bring it to you just as expected. 

Being about to graduate, we'd like to present you this wonderful levitating lamp. We would be very grateful if you can support us and help us bring this beautiful product to more people. Your "yes" greatly encourages us to make more designs in the future. 

All videos and pictures are shot by ourselves with our mobiles. We do hope that you can get the idea of what we've made and show encouragement. 

We've assembled it ourselves and tested for lots of times to make sure it works in excellent performance. Made of wood and silica gel, it's green and durable.

From design to prototype production, we've been all involved in the process. Now all work is done. 

All we need is your support so we can  consign the factory to start manufacturing. They promised to charge only the cost in the making, which is really supportive.

It is priced $109 including all production and transport costs.

Since all the design work has been completed, we'll schedule the production based on the number of existing and expected backers when the project is undergoing raising fund. So idealically, just within only 7 days  after the campaign is finished, shipment of this lamp can begin. 

MORE INFO.

With two functions in one,  it provides great convenience for your life. Somehow it is empowered with life insteading of just a lighting machine. 

OPERATION GUIDE

Production Plan

  Multiple functions all in one, convenient and cost-effective.

You may need one in your room too.

 

COMMENTS

We have sent out for test reviews and received many comments. For example:

Awesome & great looking levitating blue tooth speaker lamp with 3 different brightness modes. Great sound quality for it size and a perfect decoration for your side table, center table and/or shelf.

------- From Paul Cboi

This is just amazing! My kids just love it!

------- From Susie A

Welcome to comment, share, and support!

story:
YOUR GENIE NEEDS A LAMP

 

Don't just leave your smart home tech out on the shelf.

Integrate your smart home technology into some beautiful lighting designs from innovative Brooklyn-based chandelier makers Michael McHale Designs

 

Smart home technology is becoming an increasingly important part of our daily lives.  We use smart devices to control our lights, thermostats, music, and home security. We use smart home tech to set alarms, to settle bets, to tell us the weather -- even to tell us jokes. It's only going to integrate with our lives more profoundly over the next few years.

But our homes are also the places where we express our design taste. Until now, there's been no good way to incorporate and integrate the tech part of our lives with the design part. We end up having our smart tech plugged into a wall and sitting on a shelf, at the periphery of where all the action is happening in your home -- in the middle of the room.

 

"Hey Alexa - What's with all the cords and plugs?

 

 

Wires, plugs, and plastic: Not a good look for your home.

 

INTRODUCING THE BUSHWICK SMART HOME COLLECTION

 

The Bushwick Smart Home Collection from the innovative Brooklyn-based chandelier studio  Michael McHale Designs is a set of gorgeous lights and lamps for your tech-enabled interior.

 

There's a pendant, a linear suspension, a desk lamp, and a floor lamp.

All these lights feature a simple yet striking set of frames and a double wall of crystal to create a centerpiece which is simple yet luxurious. Each works beautifully as a conventional light.

But they are designed to become, at your option, the center of your smart home. They are designed to house your Amazon Alexa Echo Dot or Google Home Mini (not included). Install your smart device inside of your Bushwick Light and you've hidden all those wires, plugs and boxes associated with smart home tech inside a gorgeous piece of high-end lighting design; You've also positioned those microphones and speakers exactly where audio professionals recommend: in the middle of the room  while enhancing rather than compromising your interior aesthetics.

When you install your smart home device into the light along with smart bulbs from companies such as Philips Hue, LIFX, or Cree the magic starts to happen. Now, your Bushwick Smart Home Light can turn off and on at the sound of your voice, change colors, or, at your command, pulsate with your music. The double-wall of pure crystal heightens the effects and colors of the smart bulbs and turns the LED signals on the smart device itself into a satisfying refracted flourish of light and color.

All Bushwick Smart Home Lights are designed to be future-proof: they will be able to carry whatever new home tech comes down the pike, including the rumored Apple Mini Home Pod. We can even adapt any Bushwick fixture to become a Powered over Ethernet (or "PoE") device -- the first PoE decorative lighting solution out there (ask us about it). This is all cutting-edge stuff.

While we normally work with expensive, high quality gem-cut crystal, for this campaign we are offering all Bushwick Collection lights in K9 Borosilicate Crown Crystal, a more affordable option which will make Bushwick Collection lights available to more people.

 

Who We Are

 

Michael McHale Designs was founded in 2007 with the idea that contemporary decorative lighting needed new ideas. We wanted to push the envelope as to what lighting could do both  aesthetically and functionally. We were at the vanguard of the industrial-chic trend in lighting -- making chandeliers, lamps, sconces, and pendants from rough-hewn gas pipes and fittings which were then drenched in high-quality glamorous crystal to create a complex studies in materials, structure, and contrast.

 

The best-selling Tribeca Banqueting Chandelier

 

We created modular decorative lights, where you could change the look of a fixture without changing the fixture itself (The Matrix Collection), lights from 3D printed carbon fiber, and lights from discarded Blackberry phones.

We feel that lighting is important. It's the first thing you see when you walk into a room. It can do so much more than we are currently allowing it to.

 

HOW TO SUPPORT THIS CAMPAIGN

 

For this Indigogo campaign we are introducing all four lights in Bushwick Smart Home Collection at deep discounts of between 40% and 50% off the retail price. And, exclusively for Indigogo, we have the option of ordering it with K9 Borosilicate Crown Crystal, a less expensive grade of crystal, for even further savings.

We are also offering custom T-shirts, our special Signature Crystal, and gift certificates for 20% savings on any fixture we make.

All Bushwick Lanterns ordered during this promotion will ship in September.

story:
Call to Action.  Would you please help our cause by purchasing a book and sending it to the Department of Corrections and prison Wardens nationwide? 

We need you and all interested in supporting, approving, and implementing a change to allow inmates to make money selling their art to pay their restitution, child support, and other societal debts.  At the same time, the program Art for Redemption would also allow inmates to have dollars to stay in touch with family and friends; the potential to build savings for when they are released supports the significant goal of reducing recidivism.  

We have worked with Executive Director Dean Williams her win Colorado to put those changes in place. He is writing the fwd of the book and a letter addressed to these individuals on why he has made those changes here in Colorado, hoping to get others to do the same. 

Our coffee table book is what we believe will be the best way to showcase the art and the words of this program and opportunity.  The American criminal justice system holds almost 2.3 million people in 1,833 state prisons, 110 federal prisons.  It’s too many people, a crumbling old model of justice, and our Prison System must reform. (Mass Incarceration: The Whole Pie 2020 | Prison Policy Initiativehttps://www.prisonpolicy.org › reports › pie2020)

 

Summary

  • Art for Redemption is a network of individuals seeking to connect and bridge friends, families, Prison Administrators, and other interested parties to create pathways of success from the “inside out” through art production.  The organization was founded by a formerly incarcerated individual who believed there was a way to celebrate the artistic talent “inside” and to encourage financial accountability of art producing inmates through the potential sale of their works towards paying restitution, child support, commissary, phone calls, J-Pay fees (institutional email), and even potentially be savings to support reintegration once released.  Colorado approved vendor status for Art for Redemption to support achieving these goals.

 

  • Our campaign is to build awareness and financial support to produce our coffee table book featuring Works of Art from the incarcerated, letters from Prison Administrators regarding this initiative’s breakthrough opportunity.  These efforts and outcomes directly support family members in their challenges regarding the stigma and hardship they experience when loved ones are incarcerated.  It also supports reduced recidivism by supporting pathways of success and growth through the experience in the justice system. We are looking to broaden and strengthen our network through financial support. We believe this effort is critical to prison reform and social justice.

 

  • Your contribution will be a part of transforming pathways through the justice system and support prison reform.  By expanding and broadening awareness and support, we can support those who can learn from their mistakes and participate in our civil society as a part of the greater community.  We hope you will join us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

NEED

  • $25,000 will produce the book into a printable file. This includes all the layout, editorial writing, etc...  
  • $25,000 for operational funds for the company. This will get us more robust Print On Demand (POD) and NFT platforms and funds to communicate with the artist, social media marketing, etc... 

 

PATHWAYS (PURCHASES) YOU CAN TAKE TO HELP US REACH OUR GOAL:

  • $500 - book with an original artwork that is showcased in the book (50 Available)
  • $165 - Buy a book send a book to a warden or DOC head (2000 Available)
  • $170 - Buy a book send a book to an artist/(or family member) that is in the book (includes shipping) (100 Available)
  • $80 Book with shipping (100 Available)
  • $30 AFR T-shirt 
  • $25 - Mural Print w/ Augmented Reality (AR) tech 

What if we don’t meet our goal?  If we don't reach our entire goal - the book will scale down from 100 artists to the number that we can produce with funds raised

The Impact

Breaking through the stigmas, preconceived ideas about what it means when someone has been incarcerated.  Incarceration is a big, scary, large encompassing word.  Prison triggers broad ranges of imagination about what it is like.  Breaking down stigmas and uncovering potential opportunities to diminish incarceration by reducing recidivism.  

The personal and human impact is that this effort opens up the conversation around how incarceration impacts the individual and the community, family, and friends.  This project aims to provide a sense of possibility and something to work on, something to share.  It is an opportunity to help people stay in touch, maintain, and potentially build a support system that is deeply needed when released. 

Revenue earned by the Artists from the sales of their works would:

  • Restitution payment for victims 
  • Child support - if there is 
  • Build some financial independence while serving time to reduce the further drain on the family eco-system 

Founder, Buck Adams, has a track record of bringing concepts to fruition with previous ventures, Veterans to Farmers, circle fresh farms, and other endeavors.  In each case, the commitment to new models and service to the community has met needs and demands.   

  • But for building trust in relationships through hardships like experiencing prison, anyone could find themselves alone.  Buck Adams’ desire to share lessons from his experience in prison to support others navigating their experience has been built from his gratefulness to his friends and family.  All involved learn, heal and hope for a better future ahead.  We are grateful for the support that will come from this campaign.

 

Risks & Challenges

Not everyone likes people who have been to prison.  Some feel that they deserve whatever comes to them due to their infractions.  We hope that through the art and conversations of the artists' diverse backgrounds, we could open people’s minds to be open to potential ways to support successful reintegration and participation in community good.  There are few incarcerated people who do not seek a second chance.  We hope this effort will support those who have learned from their mistakes and want to be a part of the community at large as contributors. 

  • Art for Redemption has built support of individuals inside and outside of Prison.  Administrators in the Prison system believe this project to be a pathway worth supporting.
  • We will continue to be open to dialogue, criticism, learning, sharing, and transparency.  These are the building blocks for any kind of trust.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Would you please share with your friends and networks?  We are relying on our supporters to share what we are doing.  

  • Website: https://www.artforredemption.com/

    Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/artforredemption/

    Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ArtforRedemptionCo/

    Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/ArtforRedempt/_saved/

    Twitter: https://twitter.com/artforredempt

  • Press on Art for Redemption:

    https://denverite.com/2021/08/09/art-for-redemp...

    https://www.westword.com/arts/art-for-redemptio...

 

THANK YOU

$170 - Buy a book send a book to an artist/(or family member) that is in the book (includes shipping) (100 Available)
$80 Book with shipping (100 Available)
$30 AFR T-shirt 
$25 - Mural Print w/ Augmented Reality (AR) tech 

What if we don’t meet our goal?  If we don't reach our entire goal - the book will scale down from 100 artists to the number that we can produce with funds raised

The Impact
Breaking through the stigmas, preconceived ideas about what it means when someone has been incarcerated.  Incarceration is a big, scary, large encompassing word.  Prison triggers broad ranges of imagination about what it is like.  Breaking down stigmas and uncovering potential opportunities to diminish incarceration by reducing recidivism.  
The personal and human impact is that this effort opens up the conversation around how incarceration impacts the individual and the community, family, and friends.  This project aims to provide a sense of possibility and something to work on, something to share.  It is an opportunity to help people stay in touch, maintain, and potentially build a support system that is deeply needed when released. 
Revenue earned by the Artists from the sales of their works would:

Restitution payment for victims 
Child support - if there is 
Build some financial independence while serving time to reduce the further drain on the family eco-system 

Founder, Buck Adams, has a track record of bringing concepts to fruition with previous ventures, Veterans to Farmers, circle fresh farms, and other endeavors.  In each case, the commitment to new models and service to the community has met needs and demands.   
But for building trust in relationships through hardships like experiencing prison, anyone could find themselves alone.  Buck Adams’ desire to share lessons from his experience in prison to support others navigating their experience has been built from his gratefulness to his friends and family.  All involved learn, heal and hope for a better future ahead.  We are grateful for the support that will come from this campaign.
 

Risks & Challenges
Not everyone likes people who have been to prison.  Some feel that they deserve whatever comes to them due to their infractions.  We hope that through the art and conversations of the artists' diverse backgrounds, we could open people’s minds to be open to potential ways to support successful reintegration and participation in community good.  There are few incarcerated people who do not seek a second chance.  We hope this effort will support those who have learned from their mistakes and want to be a part of the community at large as contributors. 

Art for Redemption has built support of individuals inside and outside of Prison.  Administrators in the Prison system believe this project to be a pathway worth supporting.
We will continue to be open to dialogue, criticism, learning, sharing, and transparency.  These are the building blocks for any kind of trust.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you please share with your friends and networks?  We are relying on our supporters to share what we are doing.  

Website: https://www.artforredemption.com/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/artforredemption/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ArtforRedemptionCo/
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/ArtforRedempt/_saved/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/artforredempt


Press on Art for Redemption:
https://denverite.com/2021/08/09/art-for-redemp...
https://www.westword.com/arts/art-for-redemptio...


 
THANK YOU

story:
Hi,

My name is Jordan Shao, and I am fundraising for a group of left behind Afghan interpreters and their families. These interpreters served honorably side by side with American forces while the United States were involved in Afghanistan. As everyone knows, we have passed the deadline of August 31st to pull all troops out. The last plane to leave Afghanistan has left. That means those allies that were left behind are left for dead and to fend for themselves. We have a moral obligation to help our allies and save them from Taliban executions. I am a Marine veteran who served in Afghanistan in 2009 and met my interpreter "Wali" while I was there. I was with Wali 24/7. I was assigned as his escort to everywhere he went. Interpreters embedded with American units were required to have an escort at all times.

My efforts started when I saw many big cities in Afghanistan were falling into the hands of the Taliban and Kabul were in great danger. After two weeks of trying to get his family on a flight to evacuate, we failed to do so due to the chaotic situation at the Kabul airport. Wali's family narrowly escaped death when the suicide bomber detonated the bomb at Abbey Gate.

 

What are we going to do to get these Afghan interpreters and family to safety:

The funds raised will be used to pay for their transportation, housing, food, medical, visa application fees, and all other expenses needed to get them to safety. We are actively planning the route to a neighboring country so that they can continue to work on their application for visas or refugee status. Our target is $30,000 for a total for 30 Afghans consisted mostly of women and children. This is a dangerous path and we need to do whatever we can for these people to get them to safety. $10,000 is the estimated cost to get them to safety and $20,000 is the estimate to help resettle the families to the US or another country (administrative fees, expenses while waiting for approval, and flight costs)

During the two weeks of trying to get Wali's family into a flight, I have came across other Afghans that are at risk and I decided to help them along with trying to help Wali's family. I met Tamseella and Omar during this time and learned about their story and struggle to survive. I will tell their story along with Wali's story.

Please check out ABC7 News in the Bay Area to hear Wali Speak

https://abc7news.com/afghanistan-kabul-taliban-refugees/10981260/

Wali's story:

 

Wali's family of 5 (Mother, 1 sister, 3 brothers) is still stuck in Kabul without a home, money or food of their own. They are hiding in Kabul with a family friend and are desperately trying to flee. All efforts to get them on the plane was unsuccessful and was beaten by Taliban fighters. Two of his brothers are still missing since the fall of Kabul and we don't know if they are dead or alive. We have communication with his mother, 1 brother, and 1 sister.

 

Omar's Story:

 

Omar served with American special forces from 2010 to 2012 as an interpreter. He went on missions with American soldiers on every occasion and routinely gets into fire fights and risk his life to save Americans. Everyone who served with him in Afghanistan will say that he is a honorable man and view him as a brother. When his employment with the contracting company that employed him lost the contract and left Afghanistan, he was left without documentations to prove his employment. Therefore, he has hit a wall on his application because he did not receive an HR letter confirming his employment with the American company. It is now 8 years since the company terminated his employment and still can not get his visa which he qualifies for. As a result of the Taliban take over, he is now in life threatening danger. If the Taliban finds him, he will be certainly executed in a terrible way. He is trying to escape with his cousin's wife and 2 kids that he is looking after.

 

 

Tamseella's Story:

 

Tamseella reached out to me on Facebook pleading for me to save her life and leave Afghanistan. Tamseella is a highly educated Afghan woman in her early 30's. She received a BA in business from a Afghanistan University and a MBA from an Indian University in 2020. After receiving her MBA, she returned to Afghanistan hoping to build her beloved country's economy. She was employed by the Department of Economic Development at the Presidential Palace in Kabul, directly for the President of Afghanistan. She worked for the Afghanistan government until Kabul fell to the Taliban. Tamseella had experience working with economic development projects funded by US government, a bank manager for Azizi bank, and a news channel in Kabul. Tamseella is among the most vulnerable group under Taliban rule; female, educated, and single. The fate that she if she stays in Afghanistan is rape, slavery, and forced marriage to a Taliban fighter. Tamseella is an avid reader with many New York Times best sellers such as "Michelle Obama" and "Steve Jobs" biography. She hopes to one day be able to live with dignity and freedom with the ability to follow her passion and heart.

 

Azizi's (Z) Story:

Azizi has been supporting the US effort in Afghanistan since 2010 as an interpreter for many commands and both Afghanistan units and American units. Azizi's expertise and experience in communicating was instrumental in creating effective training for the Afghan National Army. His friends in the US military passionately calls him "Z". Those who worked with Azizi will normally say that he is a man of honor and can be relied on to be at the thick of battle. Z will not hesitate to come to his friends and allies aid in or out of combat. Azizi is currently in the process of the SIV process but have not received approval. Z is married with 7 children, with the oldest at 16 years and youngest at 4 years old. Z has been serving his native country and supporting the US effort for many years and now needs your help in keeping his family safe.

story:
Afghans are hunkered down at home and running out of airtime on their pre-paid mobile phones.  

Through humanitarian networks, I have access to the mobile phone numbers of some of these vulnerable people. Using online services, I am able to top up pre-paid phones directly.

To support this work:

https://amzera.cc/the-airtime-project

or via this website.

For updates beyond 27 August, please contact me via the: 'Ask a Question' link here, or see the FAQ document here:

https://amzera.cc/the-airtime-project

Best regards,

Patrick Fruchet

The Airtime Project

Amzera Consulting, LLC

story:
Men's Magazine

This is a magazine about Men. Unlike most other magazines, our focus will be on the needs of Men versus our need to make a profit or to appease advertisers. Our magazine is made by those of us who care.

This project is being headed up by Chris "mad_cat" Votey and Catherine McClain. Both have done work in the Men's Movement, including the Lovely Ladies of Men's Issues Calendar, which mad_cat co-created with Modern Medusa, and Catherine modeled for. They desire to do more for men which led to the creation of this magazine in hopes to get the information out in the world about the human rights crisis surrounding issues Men have to deal with, including False Rape Culture, Male Genital Mutilation, Forced Envelopment (males forced to penetrate), Family Court Bias, and overall Empathy Gap.

We want to a take moment to state very clearly, this isn't an anti-woman magazine. Much like the Lovely Ladies calendar, this will feature the participation of women (as well Men) and it is our hope that it can help bridge the gender divide.

The goal of this campaign is to be able to produce at minimum two magazines that is packed full of information related to male struggles but includes book reviews, fiction, humor, and images of people who support this movement. It is our desire for this to be an exposé of Male Culture with ongoing publications each and every year. If this campaign reaches its initial goal, we will be able to produce two small magazines. However, if we reach our first stretch goal, issue #2 will be larger than issue #1.

The importance of this project is to create, in essence, a time capsule. This magazine will reflect the world attitudes towards men, both of mainstream and those within the Movement. In the past we have done calendars, which was successful. However, the problem in doing the calendars is that they tend to keep value for the year they represent. A magazine has the benefit of being timeless, which gives reason for people to get issues when they're release and possibly order back issues for any they missed.

Your contribution will help us get the first two issues released. It is our hope that there is interest in the magazine so that each issue released will pay for the next one that come after. This may only be a two issue release, but we hope that all of you will find great value in this project for men, that you want to buy later editions so we can give men a representation in a innovative way.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $500, which is enough to get issue #1 printed, buy envelopes, and to get postage to send everything out. It is our hope that in reaching this goal that over time we'll get enough to release a second issue and possibly more.

 

Stretch goals

COMPLETED $750 - Second magazine - Issue #2 we want to make bigger and better than the first, with more articles, features, and models. This is the reason why we need more money to produce it as well as needing more to ship it.

$1200 - Special Edition - This will be a special version of the magazine that will feature issue #0, #1, and #2, together. This may also have additional content as well. If we reach this goal, this issue will be released in June of 2021.

 

Perks

$1 - Thank You - This is to show your support for what we're doing. Every bit helps.

$5 - 10x Male Privilege Cards - Featured on boysmenissues.com, this is a special deal to get 10 Male Privilege Cards that you can give to the men in your life, whether family or friends, or just give to random men. Value of $8. (This product is already created)

$5 - #0 - This will be a demo product of our magazine that we are producing independently of this campaign, that will feature a few models and a few articles to show people what we're about and how we intent to go about this. It is our hope that with this demo, more people will want to invest in issues #1 and #2. Value $10.

$8 Low Tier Bundle - 10x#0 - This is a combination of the 10 Male Privilege Cards and issue #0 at a discount. Value $18.

$10 - Lovely Ladies Quick Reference Guide - A donation from the Lovely Ladies of Men's Issues, a book that has facts about men's issues and the Lovely Ladies of 2020. This will include the physical book and the digital version. Value $17 (This product is already created)

$12 - Men's Magazine Issue #1 - This will be our first official release in time for International Men's Day and ICMI 2021. Value $15.

$12 - Men's Magazine Issue #2 - This will be our first official release in time for International Boy's Day. Value $15. If we reach the first stretch goal, the value of this will not change.

$15 - Mid Tier Bundle -  This will include the 10 Male Privilege Cards, Issue #0, and the Quick Reference Guides. Value $35

$20 - High Tier Bundle - This will include issues #0, #1, #2. Value $41

$25 - Special edition - If the Stretch is complete, we will offer the Special Edition magazine which will be 3 issues in one.

$50 - Ultimate Tier Bundle - This will feature all perks not including the Special Edition. $66

$100 - Producer Credit - This perk will feature the name of the donator in the magazine as a producer, and will include all items in this campaign, including any stretch goals after launch. (Limit 20)

 

How Funds Will Be Used

Starting off, our intended goal is to produce issue #1 and issue #2. As we learned from doing the calendars, there is a lot of overhead when it comes to production and shipping. If for any reason we do not get our intended goal, we will use whatever funds we get to do issue #1 and honor those who donated.

Because we're a smaller independent company, our magazines are more expensive compared to other larger companies that can give more content. We hope one day to be in a position to match them, but starting off, we need to charge more due to overhead and the potential to make more magazines beyond the initial two.

One of the key difference between us and many other magazines, is that we are not dependent on our advertisers. Advertisers are how magazines are able to make their issues affordable for the consumer, which means that if an advertiser wants to cut off funding for space in the magazine, the magazine will do what they can to keep the business, which can mean a sacrifice of integrity. Our magazine will make use of advertisers who will need to pay for space, but we won't be dependent on their contributions, so should an advertiser wish to pull out due to content we create, it is our goal that the content comes first.

Our ultimate goal is to make this an ongoing project. Whether we do this once a quarter or once a month, we would love to have a magazine that truly represents men's issues and celebrates masculinity. With that, (eventually) we would want to hire a small staff to make producing a magazine easier.

 

Magazine Features

 

#0

The first magazine we'll release will be more of a demo of what our magazines will look like. This will be released in time for Fathers' Day & Fourth of July. This will include an article of the reunion of a father and son, a brief on construction safety, a centerfold of co-creator Catherine (who will also be the cover model), a discussion of how the media focuses on single mothers for Fathers' Day, and lastly some gift ideas for Fathers' Day.

 

#1

This will be our first official magazine release in time for International Men's Day and International Conference for Men's Issues 2021. Nothing is set in stone for this magazine or any future magazines, but we are planning to have a discussion on Bespoke Boxes, cartoon images throughout, looking at ICMI 21, the start of a serial story, a look at UnSung Heroes of the movement, a male centerfold, and a jokes page.

 

#2

We have even less planned for this issue, but as we get closer to designing issue #1, we will have more of an idea of what to do with this issue. Our focus will be more on International Boy's Day, but will coincide with with Women's Month. While we intend to look at some issues related to boys, we also want to call out great women in the movement and not so great women.

 

The Impact

We all know males in our lives, whether it is our children, fathers, uncles, brothers, husbands, nephews, or even friends. To really bring up issues males face in our world today, unfortunately, falls on deaf ears. There is more concern for what happens to females than it does to males. We firmly believe everyone deserves to be heard and we shouldn't lazily label a whole group because it is convenient, however, because so many take the easy way out, men are invisible.

The importance of this magazine is that we cannot compete in the gender arena as the Feminists can, who can sway the audience for simply being a woman. In the interest of men, we have to find unique ways to get the message out there. In the past, we did the Lovely Ladies calendars, to not only get issues known, but to show that so many women support this movement. Now we want to take this to the next level by producing a magazine that can give further insights into what men are dealing with.

 

What More You Can Do

One of the best things anyone can do for this campaign beyond donating is to get the word out about what we're doing. We invite you to hit the share button and get the message out. Or you can copy our link and share this on Facebook, Twitter, MeWe, Minds, Parler, Instagram, and Gab. The more people know of what we're doing, the more successful we'll become.

While we intend to look at some issues related to boys, we also want to call out great women in the movement and not so great women.
 

The Impact
We all know males in our lives, whether it is our children, fathers, uncles, brothers, husbands, nephews, or even friends. To really bring up issues males face in our world today, unfortunately, falls on deaf ears. There is more concern for what happens to females than it does to males. We firmly believe everyone deserves to be heard and we shouldn't lazily label a whole group because it is convenient, however, because so many take the easy way out, men are invisible.
The importance of this magazine is that we cannot compete in the gender arena as the Feminists can, who can sway the audience for simply being a woman. In the interest of men, we have to find unique ways to get the message out there. In the past, we did the Lovely Ladies calendars, to not only get issues known, but to show that so many women support this movement. Now we want to take this to the next level by producing a magazine that can give further insights into what men are dealing with.
 
What More You Can DoOne of the best things anyone can do for this campaign beyond donating is to get the word out about what we're doing. We invite you to hit the share button and get the message out. Or you can copy our link and share this on Facebook, Twitter, MeWe, Minds, Parler, Instagram, and Gab. The more people know of what we're doing, the more successful we'll become.

story:
This is for the family of the man who saved my life when I was lost in the ocean. If not for him on that day, we would not be celebrating the birth of our new child today.

We have nearly everything we need for newborn life. But my newfound family in Indonesia is struggling with the government lockdown and no work.

In lieu of baby gifts for us, please send them support. Food is $150/month for the family. School is $350/term for each child (2). $2100 covers one year of food and school in Nipah.

You can use this link to support or donate directly to the family through paypal.me/ikawati1905

Our baby would not be here if it wasn't for Pur (and his partner Ika who let him go fishing on that fateful day), so please help us shower them with gratitude.

She arrived at 00:59 in the morning. But she wouldn't be here if it wasn't for him. We got what we need for the baby. But can you help feed their family and pay for the kids' school? 

If you want to send money to them, there's 2 options...

  1. Click here. 
  2. Or just chip in some here.

Thank you!

P.S. Here's a personal message from Purnawan in Nipah (in Bhasa, Indonesian): 

"Kakak mungkin saya tidak bisa membuat kata kata seperti itu,bantuan bantuan yang sudah kakak berikan sama saya dari dulu sampai sekarang,saya sangat bersyukur sekali. Saya tidak mau nanti orang orang bilang kalauk saya ini terlalu merepotkan mereka."
(translated via google)
"Brother maybe I can't make words like that, the help you have given me from the past until now, I am very grateful. I don't want people to say that I am too much trouble for them."

P.P.S. Here's the FAQs upfront:

Where's the money go? How's it get there?

-- We send it to Ika and Pur. They got paypal. It's connected to their card.

What will you do with any extra funds raised?

-- With anything over the goal, we'll send it to the village or to people on the island who need help.

How can we help out more?

-- Spread the word. Tell your friends and folks. Sharing is caring too.

story:
• Every year, thousands of bills and other forms of legislation are introduced to the U.S. Congress by our elected politicians
  • Many of these bills end up becoming the laws that govern our daily lives as U.S. citizens
  • Yet, many of us have little insight into what legislation is actually being proposed by Congress, the content and implications of that legislation and how our elected politicians are voting on our behalf to enact such legislation
  • Additionally, corporate lobbying efforts and outsized funding from wealthy political donors and special interest groups has increasingly drowned-out the voices of the vast majority of the American electorate when it comes to passing legislation

 

 

  • CivX is an easy-to-use mobile app that offers an intuitive, interactive and fun way to discover legislation in Congress, become an informed citizen and make your voice heard

 

 

  • Through its platform, CivX aims to create a community where we can all become engaged and empowered citizens as well as de facto lobbyists for the causes and issues that impact our everyday lives

 

 

  • CivX curates trending legislation related to pertinent issues in the news cycle and also showcases other unique, interesting and surprisingly bizarre bills that hit the Congressional docket
  • Curated legislation on CivX includes custom summaries and, in selected instances, original CivX video content that presents the key facts, positions and circumstances of each bill in an objective, non-partisan and entertaining manner
  • All legislation is presented in a card-like format with digestible, summary details presented on the front and more fulsome information presented on the back, including a feature that allows users to seamlessly access the full text docketed in Congress
  • Users have access to the full library of docketed legislation in Congress (organized across 100+ categories) with the ability to filter bills by category or utilize the search function to look up specific bills
  • Users can create a unique profile and set push notifications to track progress as the legislation moves through Congress - seamlessly stay informed

 

 

 

 

  • CivX offers a unique, entertaining and engaging way to become an informed citizen!

 

 

  • CivX cards are pushed to users in a carousel-like manner
  • Interface allows users to seamlessly swipe-right to Support or swipe-left to Oppose any particular piece of legislation
  • Users can keep track of all positions taken, reference legislation details and even alter positions if there has been a change of heart

 

 

 

  • CivX can be integrated with Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn accounts, allowing users to share bills on their social media news feeds
  • Feature is a powerful tool for users to seamlessly promote bills of interest across their social media networks to drive awareness for legislation related to social, economic, health and other pressing societal issues and causes

 

 

  • Finally, a platform to make important legislation GO VIRAL!

 

 

  • If you feel very strongly about a particular bill, CivX allows you to take a step further with its unique and innovative system for making political contributions
  • CivX has created a first-of-its-kind platform for users to signal what legislation they strongly support or oppose through actual monetary contributions

 

 

  • Unlike traditional political contributions, which are made directly to individual candidates, the goal of CivX Contributions is to reward lawmaking ACTION taken by elected members of Congress that aligns with YOUR personal views on issues
  • The beta version of CivX Contributions is anticipated to be launched in January 2021. Please visit our website for a detailed tutorial on how CivX Contributions will work (here)
  • Finally, a way to crowdfund legislation and the causes behind it!

 

 

  • As an extension of the app, the CivX website is intended to become a public destination for useful and insightful information related to federal legislation
  • We will be publishing CivX Stats, which include informative and digestible statistics related to legislation currently before Congress (view our beta version of CivX Stats here)
  • In the future, we intend to share summary-level information related to user activity on the CivX app (e.g., most-supported bills, most-opposed bills, most shared bills, bills with largest contribution pools, etc.)
  • In addition, users of the CivX app will be able to log into their accounts on the website to view more detailed information related to their own usage, engagement and relative activity within the CivX community
  • We envision continually releasing new features that complement the existing community and core functionality of the app
  • Such features could include expanded video content and legislation detail, politician “score cards” showing Congressional voting and committee activity compared against CivX community voting and featured politician view points on selected legislation
  • In the future, we envision expanding the platform to the state and municipal levels, further extending connectivity and civic discourse within the U.S.

 

 

  • Our founding team is comprised of six passionate professionals with diverse backgrounds and highly-complementary experience, spanning energy, finance, media/entertainment, marketing and tech
  • We are located across the country and share a deep recognition of the current disconnectedness and growing apathy present amongst the majority of the electorate
  • Our goal with CivX is to provide citizens with a fun, informative and non-partisan community that will serve to expand participation in civic discourse, provide transparency and give people a meaningful voice again
  • To learn more about the team, please visit the CivX team page on our website (here)

 

 

  • To date, the founding team has invested significant time and effort to successfully develop and launch an initial version of the app that includes curated content, custom videos, back-end data analytics, company website and social media presence
  • Funding to date, which has been modest, has been entirely self-financed by the founding team members. However, this is only the beginning and we still have more work to do in order to make our vision a reality
  • Our goal is to raise $50,000 through this Indiegogo campaign to accelerate the growth of the CivX platform
  • Funding will be used to cover costs associated with: development (e.g., app upgrades, new app features, website), content creation, generating brand awareness and general overhead costs (e.g., accounting, legal, web hosting)
  • We are seeking early adopters within the Indiegogo community to contribute towards our development and also become advocates for CivX

 

 

We would be grateful for your support as an Indiegogo backer. At a minimum, we would appreciate your help with the following:

  • Download the app and start using it
  • Promote this campaign page throughout your networks to help spread the word
  • Follow us on our social media channels: Instagram / Facebook / Twitter

 

We are excited for you to become a part of this movement.

The CivX team

story:
Minnesota NORML

Our mission is to repeal Minnesota's marijuana prohibition laws so that responsible adult use is no longer subject to penalty. We are building a statewide, grassroots campaign to fully legalize, equitably regulate and reasonably tax cannabis and to establish rights for personal home cultivation in Minnesota. We are currently a financially fledgling organization with vast potential if only we can build our organizational capacity. 

State of Cannabis Prohibition in Minnesota

In 2013, Minnesota taxpayers spent $140,000,000 arresting 11,650 Minnesotans for cannabis "crimes," 88% for possession, despite the fact that we live in a state that “decriminalized” possession in 1976. Minnesota's cannabis prohibition is characterized by the stark racial disparities in "marijuana" arrests with nearly 8 African Americans being arrested for every 1 European American and in Minneapolis, the racial disparity is nearly 12 to 1. A "marihuana" arrest can cause someone to loose job, housing, educational and/or public assistance opportunities. 

Full legalization and regulation of cannabis for personal use by adults will save Minnesotan lives from the devastating collateral consequences of being arrested, it will save all of that taxpayer money and law enforcement resources asininely wasted on a farce of a "crime," and it will allow police to more effectively focus on preventing and solving real crimes, such as violence and property crimes. Full legalization will strengthen Minnesota's economy by creating thousands of new jobs and generating tens of millions of dollars in annual tax revenue. 

The Minnesota legislature is not currently taking cannabis legalization seriously, as most of our state representatives and senators are cowardly and irresponsibly avoiding the issue. We need to galvanize the voices of our thousands of members and continue to grow our base in order to increase the number of constituents that our state legislators are hearing from. We need to make full legalization one of the most popular issues discussed in Minnesota to guide public opinion and eventually the political will before we can expect any significant progress. Minnesota NORML is building a Legislative Advocacy Team, a statewide network of cannabis legalization activists who will contact their elected officials as needed and organize local bases of support in every Minnesota legislative district in Minnesota. We're currently working together on completing the Cannabis Count, which will inform us of where each of our 201 state legislators stand on the issues of prohibition and legalization, and we're also recruiting thousands of Minnesotans to Caucus for Cannabis during the 2016 Election year. We have a legislator who has committed to authoring and introducing an act proposing a constitutional amendment to repeal "marijuana" prohibition and fully legalize, equitably regulate and reasonably tax cannabis during the 2017 legislative session, contingent on the outcome of the Elections, which gives us ample time to build the capacity of the Legislative Advocacy Team to powerfully support the passage of this legislation. 

Organizational Life Support

Minnesota NORML lost our funding this summer which led me to lay off staff and cease being paid myself. With a family to provide for, I sought work elsewhere while continuing to work for MN NORML on a part-time basis where I focused exclusively on developing new revenue streams. I formed a partnership with an experienced professional political fundraiser to launch a political telefundraising operation, which began calling Minnesota NORML members a month ago seeking donations and volunteer commitments. We are very hopeful that this will lead to the financial stabilization of our cannabis legalization advocacy organization. During the first month, with a very small team on the phones, we raised a little money and more than $20,000 in donation pledges. However, until these donations are fulfilled, and until we can fund a professional organization, Minnesota NORML is on organizational life support. 

What We’re Asking For

We ultimately need a $500,000 annual budget to hire staff to fill the following positions:

  • Government Affairs Director
  • Political Director
  • Communications Director
  • Office and Events Manager
  • Volunteer Coordinator
  • 8 Part-time Regional Organizers 
Right now we're calling on our friends, relatives, members and supporters at-large to help us raise $10,000 in the next few weeks to cover our office and most basic operating expenses and to keep me and our Associate Director, Brett Hoese working through the end of the year. This modest crowd funding campaign is a test to see if there is enough support to help sustain the organization until our tele-fundraising operation generates sufficient revenue. If we are successful with this #ReeferGladness campaign, we'll launch another crowd funding campaign with a higher goal to help us evolve from a state of survival mode to a state of thriving! There truly is no other work that I'd rather do right now than continue this fight to end cannabis prohibition and fully legalize it in my home state of Minnesota. 

Please contribute as much money as you can and help us raise money from people in your network who may be supportive of the movement for full legalization. 

Thank you!!!

mh

story:
The Product

Donald Dump is a 2 ply roll of toilet paper with alternating images of Trump and his most ridiculous statements.  We selected quotes ranging from the offensive to the idiotic. Our favorites:

  • "They honor President Obama. He's the founder of ISIS. He's the founder of ISIS.  He's the founder. He founded ISIS."
  • "I could stand in the middle of 5th Ave and shoot somebody, and I wouldn't lose voters."
  • "You may get AIDS by kissing."
  • "Sorry losers and haters, but my I.Q. is one of the highest -and you all know it! Please don't feel so stupid or insecure, it's not your fault."

 

Only Two Months until the election

Donald Trump is the Republican Nominee for President of the United States. Let that sink in. He could be the President of the United States of America. Our goal is to remind people of how “Great” he really is by showcasing the crazy, offensive, sexist, homophobic, xenophobic sh*t he's said. 

 

 

     

     

    Support the very people Trump has attacked

    We are donating 100% of profits to various institutions that support the many victims of Donald Trump’s verbal assaults:

    • ACLU
    • Human Rights Campaign
    • Planned Parenthood
    • NAACP Legal Defense Fund

     

    Ways you can help

    • Gift Donald Dump toilet paper to friends, family, and neighbors
    • Send toilet paper to your elected officials (order the Politician Package and we'll mail rolls of Donald Dump TP to up to ten local politicians!)
    • Educate people by spreading Donald Dump to places you'd never expect (locker rooms, DMV bathrooms, you name it!)
    • Send our toilet paper anonymously--or not--to Trump Headquarters
    • ...and VOTING this November

story:
The Social Project to help homeless feel better!

Cocoon - How did the idea of this Social Project

 

That's why !

The homeless are people always at risk of exposure to environmental factors, especially during the winter when cold temperatures and bad weather hit harder.

In cities sprouting cardboard boxes, mattresses and other makeshift shelters often ineffective.

The entire community becomes guilty of those silent disappearances of homeless gathered in the morning why not have made it through the night.

Cocoon stems from the desire of a group of friends to tackle the emergency that homeless people are forced to face in the cold winter months.

Cocoon is a solution designed to provide dedicated shelter to protect the homeless from bad weather and cold. 

HOMELESSNESS IS A SOCIAL CONDITION

 "If you think it can't happen to you, think again” 

 

Cocoon - How does this Social Project

 

Here's the  solution

COCOON is the evolution of a market cart designed to move easily in urban environments. COCOON is not a simple cart but a real survival shell. Thanks to the technology, the homeless  will be sheltered from frost and bad weather, safe in case of illness and protected in case of aggression due to social intolerance.

Every year the number of homeless people found dead due to the exposure to weather agents is impressive, the count of those who suffer from temporary impairment, permanent and sometimes fatal health status is even higher; those who survive, however, will suffer for a cruel personal situation. with high costs for the public health services,

Cocoon is the revolutionary concept of a push vehicle for homeless people who cannot find place in public shelters (often overcrowded) from the risk of freezing and/or contracting diseases, especially in the cold nights.

This survival shell can be either mounted on a cart for individual use or on fixed supports.

Thanks to the technological protection of the shell, the occupant will be safe in case of illness and secure in case of offense due to social intolerance. Each unit contains a “black box” with GPS, call buttons and status sensors, sensitive to risk conditions, in continuous 3G connection with a central station which can activate the local police for immediate help.

Concept & Facilities

Cocoon is different from any tent, caravan, container or any other shelter existing on the market not only for its highly technological materials but also for the next generation digital technologies used.
The prototype is designed to be thermally and electrically self-contained, to eliminate to need for connection to electric outlets and heating systems. 
All these features make the Cocoon a reliable tool that can be safely handled by the homeless for a long time, overcoming a cause of mental illness: the lack of a safe shelter.
 

Endorsements:

 The Social Project Cocoon is mentored by  

Tutor in charge: Italo Ferrante

___________________________

"BOZZOLO" is the italian word for COCOON

The municipality of Milan

Società  Umanitaria

Thematic Tables Expo 2015

Italia Oggi

Tavolo Giovani - Chamber of Commerce of Milan​

Facebook page - City Angels

 

Our Timeline & Goals

 

 Technical Specifications

Structure

While designing the frame we had to consider contrasting requirements, such as the size of the cart vs. different sizes of people, weight vs. mobility in urban areas and resistance, difficult access vs. old age and/or health problems of the occupants, thermal and acoustic insulation vs. construction costs.

The Frame - The Fixed & The Mobile Part

The shape has been intentionally kept flat and square because:

  • It makes the construction process easier;
  • It reduces the need for dedicated production lines and molds; 
  • It makes possible to use materials which are commonly available on the market in flat sheets

with a significant reduction in materials and production costs.

For the prototype it was selected a tubular square iron profile with 5 mm (0,98”) and 20 mm (0,79”) cross sections. The weight is considered acceptable.
If, however, the use of the final prototype should require a significant reduction of weight, the frame will be produced in aluminum, with a consequent increase in costs of materials and processes.
        Two views of the fixed part structure and the frame in its maximum extension:

The habitability is achieved by means of a telescopic structure that extends on the front of the fixed part, designed for a man height up to 190 cm (6’3”) in the lying position. Taller people can also get in but cannotextend their legs completely. The structure of a normal cocoon will safely support up to 264 lb people.

The Cart & The Fixed Support

Cocoon is a survival cell which has been developed to meet the needs of most metropolitan areas. It is the evolution of a market cart, designed to move easily in urban environments:

pneumatic wheels sized to overcome curbs and sidewalks, manual dynamic brake and parking brake.             

The option of a static support has been subsequently introduced following the suggestion of a major municipality to quickly create a "low-cost village" meant to accommodate masses of refugees. In comparison to other emergency solutions, the cost of cocoons is very competitive (eg. container homes). We have therefore designed quick standard couplings which can adapt to the supports of different environments such as continental climates, northern climates, rural areas, hilly lands, wetlands.

The Passenger Cell

It is the warm shelter of the system. Both fixed and extensible parts have been designed with a multi-layer coating to guarantee maximum comfort and protection.

The Insulating Layer / Infill

It has acoustic and thermal insulation functions. It takes its inspiration from the thermally insulated research bases in Antarctica. The goal is to maintain internal temperatures by limiting the dispersion of the occupant's body heat while maintaining a thermal balance between the heat produced by the metabolic processes and the heat transferred to the outside, principally through the aeration of the Cocoon (convection / exchange), but also through conduction and radiation. The materials used are readily available:

  • Low-Density Polystyrene (Charged with Graphite for colder areas)
  • Plywood
  • Kraft Paper
  • Foam with Closed Cells

Pet film coated with a metallic reflecting agent, making it metallized polyethylene terephthalate (MPET), usually gold or silver in color, which reflects up to 97% of radiated heat (the same material used for emergency blankets).

Here a side is a prototype of the insulating layer.

The Outer Covering

It is designed to protect the Cocoon from rain, UV radiation and shocks. It is composed of 2 layers:

  • An EPDM jacket: it provides reliable sealing in outdoor environments. EPDM is an elastomer, chemically stable with an unbeatable resistance to UV rays, ozone, temperature, chemicals and aging substances. Under elongation it does not have a yield point, and where other thermoplastic materials become thinner and break, EPDM stretches up to 300% in all directions without losing elasticity;
  • A «skin» of colored plastic type, for aesthetic finishing, will protect the EPDM jacket and will be the basis for any advertisements, images (by donors). It is also resistant to atmospheric agents and, being above the EPDM jacket, it is somehow square and stiff.

«Epidermis» : rigid colored plastic laminate                    «Derma» : EPDM Jacket

The Inner Coating

It is the inner "finish" cover and ensures occupant’s hygiene. The inner cover is made of metal (galvanized steel), precoated with a long life antibacterial plastic film. This last generation film is particularly useful in the presence of environmental conditions that favor the proliferation of bacteria, fungi and algae, and helps maintaining hygiene in environments where regular cleaning cannot be guaranteed. Its efficacy has been demonstrated against the following types of bacteria: Escherichia coli (A), Klebisella pneumoniae (B), Staphylococcus aureus (C), Salmonella typhimurium (D), Listeria monocytogenes (E), Legionella pneumophila.

The support with antibacterial plastic film has been tested and certified. It has also been certified as non-flammable.

The Interior

Its function is to provide occupant’s comfort. The cocoon has an internal dense PVC slatted base, which is also treated with antibacterial paint. The base will bend to allow the opening and closing of the cocoon at the swivel points and compensates the inner 2 layers created by the telescopic opening mechanism. The comfort is ensured by a roll-up mat.

 

The Air Exchange System

The Cocoon’s ventilation is ensured by an air exchange grid. Fresh air passes through a passive heat exchanger for preheating; the heat is transferred from the exhaust air. A micro fan activated by a sensor helps air flow when convection is insufficient.

In the image, an aluminum film in the heat exchanger separates the outgoing warm exhausted air flow and the entering fresh air. The undulation and roughness of the material help respectively to increase the exchange surface and to create swirling flows, thus slowing down and mixing individual air masses.

The Energy

The Cocoon is powered by two batteries:

  • A traditional battery for power consuming equipment (internal lighting, air extraction fan, etc.)
  • A lithium polymer battery to power the digital services (process units, microcontrollers, sensors)

Recharging will be provided by two systems:

  • a photovoltaic panel located on the top
  • electrical outlet in the collection centers for mobile cocoons or connection to the mains for fixed cocoons (the latter option is not yet available in the prototype).

Recharging is controlled by means of an appropriate electronic system.

The Control System

The Local System

A well-protected central processing unit (CPU) controls the GPS tracking functions, monitoring of environmental parameters, a vital functions monitor, and active requests for help.
The CPU can perform logical operations to evaluate risk situations connected to critical combinations of values supplied by sensors installed in the Cocoon.
The following sensors are currently provided:

  • GPS
  • Indoor and outdoor temperature
  • CO2
  • Smoke
  • Overthrow (tilt)
  • Acceleration

A further development can be to equip the homeless with wearable sensors: the system will check the vital parameters of the occupant (mainly pulse rate and body temperature monitor) and, in critical situations, will automatically call for help via 4G.

Remote Control Center

The signals generated by the various cocoons get to an operating control center manned by staff / volunteers, who are able to control the position of all the "Cocoon" units through a "google map" tracking.
The central logic system will trigger a "health alert" or "security alarm” call on the basis of the data provided by one or more sensors according to predefined rules.
When the position, the name of the occupant and the critical parameters detected by the sensors are known, it will be possible to alert the health assistance or the security services.

 

 Team

 

Raul Morichi - Cocoon Inventor      

A graduated professional with a long career in technology as a consultant and CIO - a bit of a maverick who enjoys pushing out the boundaries.

Endlessly having new ideas and experiments to develop better solutions for life and people. If you think too that technology is not just for business or for fun but is something for improve the humanity too, the Cocoon is the first immediate aid that solves the need of a shelter when conditions are risky. With the Cocoon, social safety, security and health will be monitored by the local organizations.

 

Stefano Como - Cocoon Cofounder       

Degree in engineering at Politecnico di Milano, for more than 40 years working in the field of ICT. In this area he developed his skills by working in national and multinational companies. He currently lives in Turin and conducts management consulting oriented to the company.

Always attentive to social problems has enthusiastically embraced the idea of Raul Morichi to design and make a small personal shelter for homeless equipped with technology for the health check. Every year the homeless for bad weather and frost see compromised their health.

 

Isotta Como - Cocoon Campaign Creator

 

Giorgio Campioni - Cocoon Cartoon Creator

After his studies at the Milan IED began working as a production designer in studies of cinema and television productions for animated films. At the same time it is initially called to fill the role of assistance, teaching and subsequently, to the animated film course always at the European Institute of Design in Milan.

Collaborating with national and international projects of advertising videos, TV series, music video animation, design for films and animated TV series. In recent years, it is engaged in the production of short, medium and feature films of a religious as a director. UNICEF partner. He teaches design as a volunteer at a community of Milan.

 

Thank you for reading to the end:

The Social Project to make the homeless feel better!
story_txt:
The Social Project to help homeless feel better!Cocoon - How did the idea of this Social Project
 
That's why !
The homeless are people always at risk of exposure to environmental factors, especially during the winter when cold temperatures and bad weather hit harder.

In cities sprouting cardboard boxes, mattresses and other makeshift shelters often ineffective.

The entire community becomes guilty of those silent disappearances of homeless gathered in the morning why not have made it through the night.

Cocoon stems from the desire of a group of friends to tackle the emergency that homeless people are forced to face in the cold winter months.
Cocoon is a solution designed to provide dedicated shelter to protect the homeless from bad weather and cold. 
HOMELESSNESS IS A SOCIAL CONDITION
 "If you think it can't happen to you, think again” 
 
Cocoon - How does this Social Project



 
Here's the  solution
COCOON is the evolution of a market cart designed to move easily in urban environments. COCOON is not a simple cart but a real survival shell. Thanks to the technology, the homeless  will be sheltered from frost and bad weather, safe in case of illness and protected in case of aggression due to social intolerance.

Every year the number of homeless people found dead due to the exposure to weather agents is impressive, the count of those who suffer from temporary impairment, permanent and sometimes fatal health status is even higher; those who survive, however, will suffer for a cruel personal situation. with high costs for the public health services,

Cocoon is the revolutionary concept of a push vehicle for homeless people who cannot find place in public shelters (often overcrowded) from the risk of freezing and/or contracting diseases, especially in the cold nights.
This survival shell can be either mounted on a cart for individual use or on fixed supports.

Thanks to the technological protection of the shell, the occupant will be safe in case of illness and secure in case of offense due to social intolerance. Each unit contains a “black box” with GPS, call buttons and status sensors, sensitive to risk conditions, in continuous 3G connection with a central station which can activate the local police for immediate help.
Concept & Facilities
Cocoon is different from any tent, caravan, container or any other shelter existing on the market not only for its highly technological materials but also for the next generation digital technologies used.The prototype is designed to be thermally and electrically self-contained, to eliminate to need for connection to electric outlets and heating systems. All these features make the Cocoon a reliable tool that can be safely handled by the homeless for a long time, overcoming a cause of mental illness: the lack of a safe shelter.

story: We would to thank you for taking the time to donate to Showers For Soldiers.  Because of you, we are able to provide this premier service to our homeless veterans.  No matter if you donate a dollar or ten dollars, we are thankful.  We began this project after listening to veterans who are homeless.  A common theme we found was that a warm shower would be very appreciated among the community.
