story:
FALA ZA FALIŠ: I tako 78.000 puta!

Od 13. ožujka do 13. travnja 2017. godine imali smo kampanju prikupljanja sredstava za održavanje petog Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik. Odluka da prijatelje festivala zamolimo za pomoć bila je iznuđena, jer je Ministarstvo kulture Republike Hrvatske, preciznije njegovo Vijeće, znatno smanjilo potporu FALIŠ-u i ugrozilo njegov opstanak. Nesvjesno, isto nam je Ministarstvo pomoglo više nego što je htjelo i daleko više nego što smo mi mogli zamisliti. Za, dakle, samo mjesec dana, prikupljeno je – preko internetske indiegogo platforme i direktnim uplatama na žiro račun Udruge FALIŠ – 78.000 kuna ili preko 11.000 dolara!

Više je to, daleko više, od 10.000 kuna, koliko smo od Ministarstva dobili i odlučili vratiti, ali i od ukupne, do sada dobivene potpore iz iste institucije. Podsjećamo, Ministarstvo kulture je za drugo i treće izdanje FALIŠ-a izdvojilo po 20.000 kuna, a za četvrto 25.000. Zbrojimo li i odbijenih 10.000, četiri FALIŠ-a, a prema procjeni Ministarstva, vrijede ukupno 75.000 kuna.

Za samo jedan, peti, prijatelji festivala iz Hrvatske, Sjedinjenih Država, Njemačke, Srbije, Malezije, Španjolske, Italije, Nizozemske, Švicarske, Slovenije, Norveške, Austrije, Francuske, Češke, Danske, Bosne i Hercegovine, Mađarske, Belgije, Crne Gore i Švedske, donirali su 78.000 kuna u novcu, ali i ponudili pomoć u različitim uslugama neophodnim za organiziranje FALIŠ-a!

Svima njima, ali i prijateljskim medijima koji su pomogli oglašavanju naše kampanje, možemo, prije svega, reći iskreno i veliko FALA, te obećati bogat programski sadržaj na Maloj loži u Šibeniku, od 6. do 9. rujna, gdje će središnja festivalska tema biti „100 godina Oktobarske revolucije“.

Također, svi koji žele nastaviti pomagati FALIŠ, mogu to i dalje činiti uplatama na žiro račun:

Udruga FALIŠ, Nikole Tesle 1, 22000 Šibenik, IBAN:  HR3324110061120009120 / SWIFT: JADRHR2X; Jadranska banka dd Šibenik; Ante Starčevića 4 22000 Šibenik; Opis plaćanja: Donacija za neprofitnu udrugu Fališ; Poziv na broj primatelja: HR02  2017.

Fala!

Organizatori Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik

 

                                                               NEMOJ DA FALIŠ

Nakon četiri godine postojanja Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik (FALIŠ), Ministarstvo kulture Republike Hrvatske odlučilo mu je znatno smanjiti financijsku potporu, čime je ugroženo održavanje petog FALIŠ-a, čija je središnja tema "100 godina Oktobarske revolucije", a podtema "500 godina reformacije Crkve".

Umanjenu potporu Ministarstva odlučili smo odbiti, jer smatramo da se temelji isključivo na ideološkom protivljenju idejama FALIŠ-a te da za cilj ima postupno rušenje kvalitete programa i minoriziranje do ukinuća Festivala. Jedini način da FALIŠ nastavi postojati je da zamoli donacije prijatelja, istomišljenika i svih koji vjeruju da alternativa predatorskom kapitalizmu postoji te da je bolji svijet ipak moguć, ma koliko mu se protivio establišment podržan krupnim kapitalom.

Festival alternative i ljevice Šibenik (FALIŠ) politički je profiliran i jasno, imenom, ideološki određen Festival, kakvih je malo u jugoistočnoj Europi.

FALIŠ traje od prve srijede do subote, u rujnu, održava se na javnom prostoru gradskog foruma, svi programi su besplatni i potiču komunikaciju s publikom.

FALIŠ je jedini lijevo profilirani događaj koji potencira dijalog suvremene ljevice i religijskih zajednica, točnije crkava u, prije svega, Hrvatskoj, ali i na širem području, kao i dijalog među njihovim predstavnicima.

FALIŠ je mjesto na kojem se pravi jasna razlika između antifašizma i pokreta otpora u bivšoj Jugoslaviji te autoritarnog režima uspostavljenog nakon Drugog svjetskog rata.

Na FALIŠ-u je, prvi put u jugoistočnoj Europi, predavanje održala časna sestra Teresa Forcades.

Na FALIŠ-u je, prvi put u Hrvatskoj, u javnom prostoru održana debata između katoličkog i pravoslavnog svećenika – fra Drage Bojića i oca Nikodima Kosovića.

Na FALIŠ-u je, nekoliko mjeseci prije premijere predstave u Njemačkoj, Tariq Ali govorio o svom čitanju Don Quijotea i Cervantesa, na čemu se temeljio dramski tekst postavljen u Njemačkoj.

Prvo predavanje na otvorenom prostoru FALIŠ-a održao je filozof Boris Buden, i to na temu „Govorite li europski?“.

Jedino predstavljanje knjige „Postkapitalizam: vodič za našu budućnost“ u bivšoj Jugoslaviji i predavanje o toj temi Paul Mason održao je na FALIŠ-u.

Na FALIŠ-u je o slučaju Juliana Assangea i nadzoru interneta prvi put u Hrvatskoj govorila članica odvjetničkog tima WikiLeaksa Renata Avila.

FALIŠ je pokazao jedinstvenu kolekciju slika i crteža beatnika (Ginsberg, Ferlinghetti, Burroughs, Bukovski…) te se time nastavio na njihovu aktivističku, antimilitantnu, slobodarsku, seksualno emancipatornu i idejnim razmjenama sklonu orijentaciju.

Minimalan broj posjetitelja pojedinih programa FALIŠ-a je oko 300 ljudi, što je oko 1 % stanovnika Šibenika, a neke programe prati publika iz Splita, Zadra, Knina, Zagreba, ali i BiH, Srbije, Slovenije...

FALIŠ je događaj o kojem su izvještavali svi relevantni mediji na prostoru bivše Jugoslavije pa je tako gostovanje Terese Forcades, časne sestre ljevičarke iz Katalonije, popratilo više od 30 portala i novina, a intervju s njom emitiran je u prime-timeu hrvatske javne televizije (HRT).

Tijekom četiri godine Festivala održano je oko 50 različitih programa: osim predavanja, debata, javnih intervjua, retrospektiva i premijernih prikazivanja filmova – „Yes Man su revoltirani“ i „Fašizam d.o.o.“ – na FALIŠ-u je predstavljeno 20-ak knjiga domaćih i stranih autora, održana su tri koncerta, producirana četiri performancea i instalacija posvećena deindustrijalizaciji Hrvatske, ali i antifašizmu i njegovu položaju u suvremenom društvu. Na FALIŠ-u je održana i hrvatska premijera kazališne predstave „Demokracija“ Zijaha A. Sokolovića.

FALIŠ termine poput ljevice i socijalizma, kao i njihove simbole, vraća u javnu upotrebu tako što podrazumijeva prihvaćanje različitih političkih mišljenja kao legitimnih, dok propitivanje temeljnih vrijednosti poput antifašizma odbacuje, jer takav revizionizam smatra anticivilizacijskim činom.

Možda idealno društvo ne postoji, ali smatramo da je svako slobodno, socijalno uravnoteženo, mirno i tolerantno vrijedno napora. Cilj nam je te vrijednosti promovirati kroz sve festivalske segmente, od predavanja do kulturnih programa.

Jednako važnim smatramo zalaganje za borbu i promociju manjinskih prava i prava LGBT-osoba, inzistiranje na rodnoj i socijalnoj ravnopravnosti u javnom životu.

Smatrajući FALIŠ idejom, a ne samo javnim događajem, sudionici programa ostaju vezani uz Festival na različite načine, kao kasniji urednici, voditelji programa, savjetnici... Neki od njih su: redateljica Angela Richter (Njemačka), teologinja i časna sestra Teresa Forcades (Španjolska), filozof Boris Buden (Hrvatska/Njemačka), pisac i aktivist Tariq Ali (Velika Britanija), redatelj Aris Chatzistefanou (Grčka), pisac Andrej Nikolaidis (Crna Gora), novinar i diplomat Zlatko Dizdarević (BiH), aktivist i bivši profesionalni nogometaš Ivan Ergić (Srbija)...

Udruga FALIŠ financira se isključivo donacijama čije je trošenje transparentno, a izvješća o poslovanju Udruge javno su dostupna.

Ako smatrate da ovakav festival vrijedi Vaše podrške i vjerujete da njegovo postojanje pomaže širenju ideja boljeg, pravednijeg, socijalno uravnoteženog, slobodnog društva, podržite ga putem ove stranice ili izravno, uplatom na žiro-račun naše udruge, putem opće uplatnice ili internetskog bankarstva. Podaci su dostupni OVDJE. Mi ćemo Vam se zahvaliti službeno, materijalno i programski, nadajući se i Vašem dolasku na FALIŠ. Na još jedno mjesto za još jednu borbu.

Hvala.

I, nemoj da fališ!

                                                              Don't FAIL!

When the Croatian Ministry of Culture decided to cut significantly the financial support for FALIŠ, the Festival of Alternative and Leftism in Šibenik, after only four years of its existence, it compromised its fifth edition whose main theme is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of the October revolution along with 500 years of the Church Reformation as an additional topic.

We decided to reject  the decreased financial support of the Ministry as it doesn't allow us to cover at least partially the boarding expenses of the Festival's participants. Moreover, we believe that it's based exclusively on the ideological opposition to the ideas of FALIŠ and its goal is a gradual diminishing of the programme's quality till its abolition.The only way for Festival in order to continue its work is to turn to its friends, supporters and to those who share its opinions. We address all those who believe  that there is an alternative to the predatory capitalism and that the better world is possible in spite of all the opposition of establishment backed up by major financial management.

The Festival of Alternative and Leftism in Šibenik is the only politically distinctive and by its very name, a clearly ideologically set festival among very few similar in Southeastern Europe.

FALIŠ lasts from the first Wednesday till the first Saturday in September  and it's being held in the open public spaces. The programmes are free for all the visitors and interaction with the audience is highly encouraged.

FALIŠ is the only conspicuous Leftist event that insists on the dialogue between the modern Leftism and the Church, more precisely, the Churches in Croatia and its surrounding areas, as well as on dialogue among the religious communities.

FALIŠ is the only place where a clear distinction between antifascism and the resistance movement in former Yugoslavia is persistently accentuated, as well as a clear critique of the authoritarian regime established after the WWII.

FALIŠ hosted Catalan Sister Teresa Forcades and her very first lecture in Southeastern Europe.

At FALIŠ, the first public debate between the Catholic Franciscan Drago Bojić and the Ortodox  Father Nikodim Kosović was held.

At FALIŠ, few months before the German premiere itself, Tariq Ali talked about his reading of Don Quixote and Cervantes on which contemporary dramatic text staged in Germany was based.

At FALIŠ, for the very first time the Croatian philosopher Boris Buden held his lecture under the title "Do you speak European?".

At FALIŠ we hosted the only presentation of Paul Mason's book in former Yugoslavia, "Postcapitalism: guide to our future" and the lecture of the same title held by the author himself.

At FALIŠ, Ms Renata Avila, one of the Wikileaks lawyers, talked about the Julian Assange's case and the Internet surveillance for the first time in Croatia.

At FALIŠ, the unique  collection of the images and pictures of the Beat Generation artists       (Ginsberg, Ferlinghetti, Burroughs, Bukovski..) was presented. It was a certain follow up of their activistic, antimilitant, libertarian orientation  as well as their inclination for sexual emancipation and exchange of ideas.

The minimal number of visitors of some FALIŠ programmes is about 300 people which is approximately one percent of Šibenik's population while certain programmes are held in Split, Zadar, Knin, Zagreb and even Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Slovenia.

FALIŠ is the event about which all the relevant media on the territory of the former Yugoslavia have thoroughly reported. For instance, the visit of Sister Teresa Forcades, the Leftist nun from Catalonia was followed by over 30 Internet portals and newspapers and her interview was broadcasted at the prime time on the national TV programme ( the HRT).

In the first four years of its existence nearly 50 programmes were held;  besides different lectures, debates, interviews, retrospectives and  film premieres ("Yes Man are indignant" and "Fascism ltd" ), 20 books of Croatian and foreign writers were presented at FALIŠ, three concerts were held as well as four performances and three installations dedicated to the destruction of the industry in Croatia and the antifascism and its position in the contemporary society. In addition, the Croatian premiere of the theatre production “Democracy“ by Zijah Sokolović was held at Fališ.    

FALIŠ manages to put in use the terms like leftism and socialism as well as their symbols again in a way which implies the acceptance of different political opinions as legitimate ones, while the questioning of the basic civilizational values like the antifascism is rejected because that line of discussion is in itself essentially anticivilizational.

Maybe the ideal society doesn't exist but we think that every free society, socially well balanced, peaceful and tolerant, is worth trying. Our goal is to promote those values through all the segments of the Festival from lectures to all kinds of cultural programmes.

We consider equally important our dedication to the promotion of the rights of minorities and LGBT persons' rights as well as insisting on the sexual and social equality in the public life of any society.

Considering the Festival an idea and not only a public event, the participants remain connected to the Festival in various ways, as later editors, programme directors, counselors etc. Some of them are: director Angela Richter (Germany), theologian and nun Teresa Forcades (Spain), philosopher Boris Buden (Croatia/Germany), writer and activist Tariq Ali (Great Britain), film director Aris Chatzistefanou (Greece), writer Andrej Nikolaidis (Montenegro), journalist and diplomat Zlatko Dizdarević (Bosnia and Herzegovina), activist and former professional football player Ivan Ergić (Serbia)...

The FALIŠ association is funded exclusively by donations the spending of which is transparent and management reports are publicly available.

If you feel that such a festival deserves your support and if you believe that its existence helps the spreading of better, more just, socially balanced society, your donations to FALIŠ can be sent directly to our Association bank account, via money order or by Internet banking. All the relevant data are enclosed. We will express our gratitude  for your generous donation officially, materially and in our programme. We are all looking forward to meeting you at FALIŠ. The right place to fight.

story_txt: FALA ZA FALIŠ: I tako 78.000 puta!Od 13. ožujka do 13. travnja 2017. godine imali smo kampanju prikupljanja sredstava za održavanje petog Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik. Odluka da prijatelje festivala zamolimo za pomoć bila je iznuđena, jer je Ministarstvo kulture Republike Hrvatske, preciznije njegovo Vijeće, znatno smanjilo potporu FALIŠ-u i ugrozilo njegov opstanak. Nesvjesno, isto nam je Ministarstvo pomoglo više nego što je htjelo i daleko više nego što smo mi mogli zamisliti. Za, dakle, samo mjesec dana, prikupljeno je – preko internetske indiegogo platforme i direktnim uplatama na žiro račun Udruge FALIŠ – 78.000 kuna ili preko 11.000 dolara!Više je to, daleko više, od 10.000 kuna, koliko smo od Ministarstva dobili i odlučili vratiti, ali i od ukupne, do sada dobivene potpore iz iste institucije. Podsjećamo, Ministarstvo kulture je za drugo i treće izdanje FALIŠ-a izdvojilo po 20.000 kuna, a za četvrto 25.000. Zbrojimo li i odbijenih 10.000, četiri FALIŠ-a, a prema procjeni Ministarstva, vrijede ukupno 75.000 kuna.Za samo jedan, peti, prijatelji festivala iz Hrvatske, Sjedinjenih Država, Njemačke, Srbije, Malezije, Španjolske, Italije, Nizozemske, Švicarske, Slovenije, Norveške, Austrije, Francuske, Češke, Danske, Bosne i Hercegovine, Mađarske, Belgije, Crne Gore i Švedske, donirali su 78.000 kuna u novcu, ali i ponudili pomoć u različitim uslugama neophodnim za organiziranje FALIŠ-a!Svima njima, ali i prijateljskim medijima koji su pomogli oglašavanju naše kampanje, možemo, prije svega, reći iskreno i veliko FALA, te obećati bogat programski sadržaj na Maloj loži u Šibeniku, od 6. do 9. rujna, gdje će središnja festivalska tema biti „100 godina Oktobarske revolucije“.Također, svi koji žele nastaviti pomagati FALIŠ, mogu to i dalje činiti uplatama na žiro račun:Udruga FALIŠ, Nikole Tesle 1, 22000 Šibenik, IBAN:  HR3324110061120009120 / SWIFT: JADRHR2X; Jadranska banka dd Šibenik; Ante Starčevića 4 22000 Šibenik; Opis plaćanja: Donacija za neprofitnu udrugu Fališ; Poziv na broj primatelja: HR02  2017.Fala!Organizatori Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik                                                                NEMOJ DA FALIŠNakon četiri godine postojanja Festivala alternative i ljevice Šibenik (FALIŠ), Ministarstvo kulture Republike Hrvatske odlučilo mu je znatno smanjiti financijsku potporu, čime je ugroženo održavanje petog FALIŠ-a, čija je središnja tema "100 godina Oktobarske revolucije", a podtema "500 godina reformacije Crkve".Umanjenu potporu Ministarstva odlučili smo odbiti, jer smatramo da se temelji isključivo na ideološkom protivljenju idejama FALIŠ-a te da za cilj ima postupno rušenje kvalitete programa i minoriziranje do ukinuća Festivala. Jedini način da FALIŠ nastavi postojati je da zamoli donacije prijatelja, istomišljenika i svih koji vjeruju da alternativa predatorskom kapitalizmu postoji te da je bolji svijet ipak moguć, ma koliko mu se protivio establišment podržan krupnim kapitalom.Festival alternative i ljevice Šibenik (FALIŠ) politički je profiliran i jasno, imenom, ideološki određen Festival, kakvih je malo u jugoistočnoj Europi.FALIŠ traje od prve srijede do subote, u rujnu, održava se na javnom prostoru gradskog foruma, svi programi su besplatni i potiču komunikaciju s publikom.FALIŠ je jedini lijevo profilirani događaj koji potencira dijalog suvremene ljevice i religijskih zajednica, točnije crkava u, prije svega, Hrvatskoj, ali i na širem području, kao i dijalog među njihovim predstavnicima.FALIŠ je mjesto na kojem se pravi jasna razlika između antifašizma i pokreta otpora u bivšoj Jugoslaviji te autoritarnog režima uspostavljenog nakon Drugog svjetskog rata.Na FALIŠ-u je, prvi put u jugoistočnoj Europi, predavanje održala časna sestra Teresa Forcades.Na FALIŠ-u je, prvi put u Hrvatskoj, u javnom prostoru održana debata između katoličkog i pravoslavnog svećenika – fra Drage Bojića i oca Nikodima Kosovića.Na FALIŠ-u je, nekoliko mjeseci prije premijere predstave u Njemačkoj, Tariq Ali govorio o svom čitanju Don Quijotea i Cervantesa, na čemu se temeljio dramski tekst postavljen u Njemačkoj.Prvo predavanje na otvorenom prostoru FALIŠ-a održao je filozof Boris Buden, i to na temu „Govorite li europski?“.Jedino predstavljanje knjige „Postkapitalizam: vodič za našu budućnost“ u bivšoj Jugoslaviji i predavanje o toj temi Paul Mason održao je na FALIŠ-u.Na FALIŠ-u je o slučaju Juliana Assangea i nadzoru interneta prvi put u Hrvatskoj govorila članica odvjetničkog tima WikiLeaksa Renata Avila.FALIŠ je pokazao jedinstvenu kolekciju slika i crteža beatnika (Ginsberg, Ferlinghetti, Burroughs, Bukovski…) te se time nastavio na njihovu aktivističku, antimilitantnu, slobodarsku, seksualno emancipatornu i idejnim razmjenama sklonu orijentaciju.Minimalan broj posjetitelja pojedinih programa FALIŠ-a je oko 300 ljudi, što je oko 1 % stanovnika Šibenika, a neke programe prati publika iz Splita, Zadra, Knina, Zagreba, ali i BiH, Srbije, Slovenije...FALIŠ je događaj o kojem su izvještavali svi relevantni mediji na prostoru bivše Jugoslavije pa je tako gostovanje Terese Forcades, časne sestre ljevičarke iz Katalonije, popratilo više od 30 portala i novina, a intervju s njom emitiran je u prime-timeu hrvatske javne televizije (HRT).Tijekom četiri godine Festivala održano je oko 50 različitih programa: osim predavanja, debata, javnih intervjua, retrospektiva i premijernih prikazivanja filmova – „Yes Man su revoltirani“ i „Fašizam d.o.o.“ – na njegovu položaju u suvremenom društvu. All the relevant data are enclosed. We will express our gratitude  for your generous donation officially, materially and in our programme. We are all looking forward to meeting you at FALIŠ. The right place to fight.PERKS:10 $ – "Fala" X- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)​​​​​- the name written on the set* 25 $ – "Fala" XXV - a set of FALIS postcards - the name written on the set* 50 $ – "Fala" L- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)​​​​- a set of FALIS postcards- FALIS chocolate- FALIS T-shirt- the name written on the set* 75 $ – "Fala" LXXV- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)​​​- a set of FALIS postcards-  5 FALIS chocolates-  FALIS T-shirt- the name written on the set* 100 $ – "Fala" C- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)​​- a set of FALIS postcards- FALIS chocolate- Book: Žižek - Horvat "What Does Europe Want"- FALIS T-shirt- the name written on the set*250 $ – "Fala" CCL- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)​- a set of FALIS postcards- FALIS chocolate- first 10 donators can choose between numbered and signed replica by Alem Ćurin or a book Žižek-Horvat "What Does Europe Want" and FALIS T-shirt- the name written on the set* 500 $ – "Fala"  L- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)- set of FALIS postcards- 5 FALIS chocolates- FALIS T-shirt- Book Žižek-Horvat "What Does Europe Want"- two-day complimentary accommodation for FALIS- name written on the set*750 $ – "Fala" DCCL - letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)-  set of FALIS postcards- FALIS chocolate- FALIS T-shirt- three-day complimentary accommodation for FALIS- First two donators will get a cartoon of Tariq Ali by Mario Jurjević, signed by both the author and Ali- name written on the set*1000 $ – "Fala" M- letter of appreciation Fala by FALIS (Thank you by FALIS)- a set of FALIS postcards- 10 FALIS chocolates- FALIS T-shirt- numbered and signed graphic by Alem Ćurin- four-day complimentary accommodation for FALIS- name written on the set**All donators who wish to be mentioned can send us an e-mail to info@falis.com.hr. Moreover, whoever wishes to donate any means directly to FALIS, by transferring the money to the bank account of the Organization, is urged to send the contact information to the abovementioned e-mail, together with  delivery address.

story:
Afghanistan National Juggling Championship 2017 with Festival Events and Shows in 5 Regions.

As you see in the video the events and the championship in 2016 was a great success and for 2017 we are making it even much better.

  • We are organizing Regional & National Juggling Championships with Workshops & Performances for over 800 Underprivileged Children (45% girls) and 12000 audience in Kabul, Nangarhar, Herat, Balkh and Bamyan.
  • We improve the children's skills and promote the happy culture of educational entertainment and bring so much of joy to the children.  (Afghan girls and boys are among the very best jugglers in the world)
  • We bring everyone’s attentions including national & international media to the amazing resources in Afghanistan which is the CHILDREN. 
  • MMCC manages, supervises and administers your contributions and covers all additional expenses such as the rents & salaries & admin fees.

Join us to cover the following (remaining, estimated) costs:

- Food & Refreshment in the workshops:

1850 USD

- Transport for the teachers and children:

150 USD

- Trophies & Medals & costumes:

150 USD

- Regional and National Winner's presents:

800  USD

- Material for building juggling clubs:

400  USD

- Equipment for the events and the shows:

500  USD

Total:

5250 USD

Note:

As Indiegogo from February 2017 dose not support Paypal anymore, the Paypal contributors can donate by following MMCC Paypal link here:

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Let people know that they can support Afghanistan and the children who need some fun and joy in these difficult times by this fundraiser.

If you can't donate, but would still like to support us, share this link with friends on FaceBook, Twitter, write on your blogs, write Emails out to friends and family to let them know!

You can also help us by visiting and promoting our general donation and membership page: www.AfghanMMCC.org/members

Preperations:

story:
Short Summary

I am asking for funding to be able to build a real sized climbing wheelchair that can be tested with actual people.

  • My name is Harout Markarian, I am an engineer with bachelors in mechanical engineering and masters in controls. I am the founder of a small company called Prototek Solutions, founded in October 2016.
  • This project was part of my Master's dissertation and I am trying to bring it to life. The reason I chose this project is because I know so many challenged people around me one of them being my grand father  who can use this type of wheelchair. 
  • The success of this product can serve so many people like handicapped teenagers, adults, seniors, and specially wounded warriors. The potential is huge.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am hoping to raise $20,000 for this project to be able to build and test this wheelchair. The funding will allow me to buy the actuators and material to build the product. I might need more as actuators with big torques are expensive but I am hoping for the $20K.
  • This design has a zero turning radius, it can maneuver all terrains, and will climb all sorts of stair types.
  • The funds are going to be dedicated to completing this project and to supporting other similar projects that can help challenged individuals.

The Impact

  • This product can be vital to everyone. The contribution can help children with mobility challenges to feel they can go anywhere without help. it can give handicapped people access to places they weren't able to go before. 
  • Most importantly the goal of this stair climbing wheelchair is to be cheaper than the ones in the market.
  • One of the main goals of this project is to make the wheelchair accessible to everyone.

Risks & Challenges

Like any other project there are challenges associated with this design. The biggest challenge is going to be the safety of the user. Another challenge is the stability of its dynamic frame along with its automatically adjustable seat during climb and descent.

  • Having both theoretical and hands on experience in design and controls of dynamic vehicles I will be able to tackle these challenges one by one.
  • My plan is to complete the entire product (design and analysis) on a virtual platform, then start building the real thing. I am going to divide it into subsystems at first test individually and then complete the assembly and test it again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this with everyone so we can make a difference
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you.

Short Summary
I am asking for funding to be able to build a real sized climbing wheelchair that can be tested with actual people.

My name is Harout Markarian, I am an engineer with bachelors in mechanical engineering and masters in controls. I am the founder of a small company called Prototek Solutions, founded in October 2016.
This project was part of my Master's dissertation and I am trying to bring it to life. The reason I chose this project is because I know so many challenged people around me one of them being my grand father  who can use this type of wheelchair. 
The success of this product can serve so many people like handicapped teenagers, adults, seniors, and specially wounded warriors. The potential is huge.


What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $20,000 for this project to be able to build and test this wheelchair. The funding will allow me to buy the actuators and material to build the product. I might need more as actuators with big torques are expensive but I am hoping for the $20K.
This design has a zero turning radius, it can maneuver all terrains, and will climb all sorts of stair types.
The funds are going to be dedicated to completing this project and to supporting other similar projects that can help challenged individuals.


The Impact

This product can be vital to everyone. The contribution can help children with mobility challenges to feel they can go anywhere without help. it can give handicapped people access to places they weren't able to go before. 
Most importantly the goal of this stair climbing wheelchair is to be cheaper than the ones in the market.
One of the main goals of this project is to make the wheelchair accessible to everyone.


Risks & Challenges
Like any other project there are challenges associated with this design. The biggest challenge is going to be the safety of the user. Another challenge is the stability of its dynamic frame along with its automatically adjustable seat during climb and descent.

Having both theoretical and hands on experience in design and controls of dynamic vehicles I will be able to tackle these challenges one by one.
My plan is to complete the entire product (design and analysis) on a virtual platform, then start building the real thing. I am going to divide it into subsystems at first test individually and then complete the assembly and test it again. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share this with everyone so we can make a difference
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you.

story:
This is our first humble abode:

85 Kent Place, Akron Ohio

It may not look like much at the moment. But symbolically it is a HUGE milestone for us.

I have learned so much in the last couple years working with these incredible people who happen to be homeless at the moment. I've worked with them through an incredibly cold winter when they were staying in tents that looked like this:

Winter of 2017 - 2018, Akron Ohio

We currently have about 45 people living in our tent city.

The city of Akron and all people in authority hate our tents.

They tell us they are not fit for human habitation. They tell us they don't fit into the neighborhood. They tell us that these people shouldn't be living in tents.

I have always agreed with that. American citizens whose families have lived here for generations should definitely NOT be living in tents.

But the reality of the situation is that they are.

Over these last two years I have seen first hand unbelievable living conditions. 

Families living in drug houses because they can't afford to go anywhere else.

Men and women living on porches of abandoned and nearly falling down houses.

Countless people that live outdoors with not so much as a tarp to keep the rain off of them.

The underbelly of America is dark, sad and tragic.

On top of that, living on the streets and in the woods is highly dangerous. 

You are all but guaranteed to get all your possessions stolen the first couple nights you spend on the street. New homeless people are easy marks for thieves and predators.

Young men and women are often raped and prostituted.

Everyone I've ever met who has spent time on the street has at least been physically threatened and very often beat up... just because.

So yes, I hate that Americans are living in tents. But our tent city is WORLDS better than living on the street.

We have security and security cameras. We have laundry and showers. We have computers. We have clothing. We have food. 

We have everything you need to get stable so you can work on your mental health, your addictions and getting into housing.

But I can also tell you that getting into housing is an endless maze of paperwork, meetings, emailing and calling.

Housing providers will tell me that the homeless need to "want" a house. By that they mean they have to jump through countless hoops and wait for who knows how long.

The Akron Metropolitan Housing Authority has a 3 year waiting list with 20,000 people on that list.

What are you supposed to do for 3 years?

Today is a huge opportunity for us. WE BOUGHT OUR VERY FIRST HOUSE!

This house is directly behind our day center and tent city. So the residents of our house will be able to easily have access to our facility.

We also have maintenance and repairs to do to the house.  This is where YOU come in. 

We really, truly need your help with this home.

Your help will allow us to own this house outright. And it will also let us make the repairs that are needed to the house.

It is in desperate need of a paint job.

It needs screens for the windows.

It needs walls to be put up.

But all the bones of the house are good. The roof is good. The basement is dry. The furnace works. All the utilities work. 

By partnering with private citizens like you we don't have all the constraints of the federal government. That way we are able to quickly and efficiently move people into our house.

The key to breaking down the barriers of housing the homeless of America is YOU.

We truly need you.

We hope you will consider getting a brick for our walkway. You can put any saying on the brick you'd like.

You can offer words of inspiration. You can offer Biblical versus. Or you can just put your name. Whatever you'd like.

These bricks will be a reminder to us that the way we fix the hardest problems of the world is by working together.

Thank you for everything you have done for us so far and for everything you continue to do for us. You are amazing.

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

Sage

story:
The Album

The nine-song album features choral renditions of popular and classic songs by the likes of Lady Gaga, Ozzie Osbourne, and Shakira. The album features the talents of soloists, rappers, beat-boxers, drummers, and pianists, all of whom are affected by various challenges in their daily lives. The songs are all centered around overcoming obstacles, having perseverance in the face of affliction, and rising above limitations.
 

The Choir

The Mayday Club Youth Choir from British Columbia, Canada, performs popular and classic songs in a variety of genres, that express their message of ending bullying and promoting equality for people with neurodiversities.

The choir was founded in 2015, and has since opened for such acts as Temple Grandin and The Harlem Globetrotters. Mayday Club has sang live on CKNW News, was featured in a Lynda Steele podcast, was the subject of a documentary by Vancouver-Based production company Cutterpillow Productions, that premiered at New York Mental Health Film Festival. The choir presents lectures at UBC for aspiring professionals, and recently appeared live on Global TV to open the 2019 Variety Club Show of Hearts. 

 

The Impact

Mayday Club is a registered non-profit organization based out of Abbotsford BC, that aims to provide valuable skills-building experiences for young people with disabilities. The folk behind Mayday Club believe that by educating both the community and the youth they serve, British Columbia can become stronger, both economically and socially.

The group believes that by educating the public on neurodiversities such as autism, they can eliminate the stigmatization and exclusion of neurodiverse people from schools and workplaces.

story:
Free4Haiti

In partnership with Light and Peace Missions, we are raising funds to provide food for those that are currently displaced as a result of Hurricane Matthew. On February 2, 2017, we will travel to Haiti to purchase the supplies and distribute the food to those that are in need in the city of Les Cayes. 

About The Freedom Church

The Freedom Church was formed June 25, 2010 in Jacksonville, FL. We exists to empower people be free to worship, free to give, free to serve, and free to live. We are a church where all people can experience the transforming power of the presence of God.

About the Outreach

We contacted local organizations within the area in order to find out what is needed for the people after facing such devastation.  We discovered food is needed above all else; so we're committed to meet that need. Simple items like rice, beans, oil, and spaghetti are essentials that will provide nourishment to those in need. On February 2, 2017, we will travel to Haiti to purchase the supplies using the money we raise through this campaign.
